2:00.race_name: FBC Manby Bowdler Handicap Chase (GBB Race)

runners.name: Byzantine Empire
runners.comment: Won over hurdles here last summer but absent since pulled up over fences in November
runners.spotlight: Won off much-reduced mark over hurdles here (2m, good) last summer, but this regressive 8yo was pulled up over fences on latest outing in November and is not the percentage call today.

quotes.quote: Byzantine Empire had lost his way last season and Fergal was happy to sell him on. To be honest we've been trying to run him on good ground and the next thing you know the heavens open and it's gone heavy or soft. Good ground's the key and it's nice to see him get his head in front - Rhys Flint, trainer, talking to Sky Sports Racing.

runners.name: Abingworth
runners.comment: Back in prime form at end of last season, winning twice over 2m4f on good ground
runners.spotlight: Back in prime form at end of last season, winning on good ground over 2m4f at Wincanton and Warwick; latest 2lb rise does not look excessive and there's a good chance he'll be right in the thick of things here.

runners.name: Midnight Jewel
runners.comment: May have needed last month's low-key reappearance run but others appeal more all the same
runners.spotlight: Might have needed last month's reappearance run (over hurdles) and is now 1lb lower than when gamely making all in five-runner Fontwell chase (2m3f, good to soft) in September, but his record in recent years is rather mixed; others appeal more.

quotes.race: Jones Bros Conditional Jockeys' Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: Midnight Jewel won at Fontwell last time even though he didn't seem to enjoy the track. He's quick at the obstacles and is so game - Lilly Pinchin, rider.

runners.name: Winged Isle
runners.comment: Very tricky to weigh up on stable debut but is well handicapped and has conditions to suit
runners.spotlight: Pulled up on chasing debut in autumn 2022 and seen only once again since, when pulled up over hurdles for Neil Mulholland last summer; a very tricky horse to weigh up at present but he makes his stable debut from a good mark and with trip/ground suitable; worth a glance in the betting.

runners.name: Full Monty
runners.comment: Safely held in both handicap hurdles; makes chasing debut after 205-day layoff
runners.spotlight: Low-mileage 7yo who won a maiden hurdle at Uttoxeter (2m4f, good) last summer; safely held in two handicap hurdles in the autumn, though, and makes his chasing debut after a 205-day absence.

runners.name: Gods Own Getaway
runners.comment: Very respectable third to Abingworth at Warwick last month and remains on workable mark
runners.spotlight: Dual chase winner who was ridden much closer to the pace than is often the case when very respectable third behind Abingworth at Warwick (2m4f, good) last month; remains on a workable mark and features prominently in calculations; cheekpieces (tried once in early 2024) refitted.

quotes.race: Massaoke Race Night Friday 14th June Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: God's Own Country has taken time to mature but he's really stepped forward since going chasing, 2-3 now and a little unlucky at Warwick last time. He's on an upward curve and hopefully he'll continue that way being well-suited by the better ground at this time of year. Tom Messenger, assistant trainer.

runners.name: Okavango Delta
runners.comment: Not at best on latest outing but was a dual chase winner for his new stable last season
runners.spotlight: 2-6 for new trainer last season, with both wins gained over 2m4f at Musselburgh (good to soft/soft); not at best when last in action but should handle the faster ground here; could have a say.

quotes.race: Virgin Bet Daily Price Boosts Novices' Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: The race went to plan. We went a nice, even gallop but I was really concerned about the ground with Okavango Delta. Musselburgh, luckily, when it gets soft it doesn't get too deep, so he's handled it fine. He's in good form and he's got his second round here now. You don't want to hit the front too soon with him, but he jumps so well you often land in front early enough, so you've got to hope he takes you through the race. In fairness, when I committed today, with the cheekpieces on he's honest enough - Craig Nichol, jockey.

runners.name: Marys Fortune
runners.comment: Back under rules with two low-key runs this year; cheekpieces refitted today
runners.spotlight: Ex-French mare; won a point on British debut in 2023, but returned to racing under rules with two low-key runs this year (chase/hurdle) and needs a good boost from the refitted cheekpieces today.

runners.name: Scene One
runners.comment: On a good mark but does not always look enthusiastic; headgear switched again
runners.spotlight: Well handicapped on form as recent as the winter but needs to better his recent efforts and does not always look wildly enthusiastic; raced mainly on good to soft/soft ground but has won on good; refitted blinkers the headgear of choice today.

runners.name: Uncle Arthur
runners.comment: Struggled last season and is 10lb wrong for first run since October
runners.spotlight: Struggled on all three starts for Sarah-Jayne Davies last season (chase/hurdle) and is 10lb out of the weights for first run since October.

quotes.quote: The drop in class was key for Uncle Arthur. On ratings it looked a stiff task but Iddergem was maybe slightly overrated and we were very hopeful. This trip around Ludlow suited him and he might get a bit further on that showing - Fergal O'Brien, trainer.

2:30.race_name: PJ Nicholls KGM Korea Genuinely Made Handicap Chase (GBB Race)

runners.name: South Omo Zone
runners.owner: South Omo Zone & Middleham Park Racing
runners.comment: Bumper/hurdle winner and now goes chasing with a pointing background
runners.spotlight: Bumper winner on good and a maiden winner on good to soft; feasible excuses for last two runs on account of ground/trip and now goes chasing with a pointing background; first-time tongue-tie.

quotes.race: Cheese & Cider Race Night 16th April Maiden Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: South Omo Zone has a lovely way of going and he's a very straightforward horse. He settles well, he jumps well and he stays, and that's all you want. He's obviously had a bit of time off, but he'll be a chaser in time. Hopefully we can stay in one piece and go from there - Sean Bowen, rider.

runners.name: Doyouknowwhatimean
runners.breeder: Exors Of The Late Michael Lysaght
runners.comment: Competitive at Chepstow the last twice and same mark as for latest narrow defeat
runners.spotlight: Had luck on his side when winning narrowly at Chepstow (2m, good) but nearly followed up back there under a penalty, albeit in a three-runner race; same mark here and entitled to be in the thick of it.

stable_tour.quote: He ran very acceptably at Newton Abbot first time up last month over a trip that was plenty far enough. It was the first chance I'd had to get a run into him, given the ground, and I think he could be winning again soon over a slightly shorter distance. 12-11-24

runners.name: Prolific Profile
runners.comment: Three-time hurdle winner who had been in a good run of form until last time; chase debut
runners.spotlight: Three-time hurdle winner who had been in a good run of form until last time, though the winner of that Hereford race ran well in the Swinton last weekend; can go well if taking to fences.

runners.name: Moodofthemoment
runners.comment: Mostly consistent for this yard and needs respecting despite a career-high mark
runners.spotlight: Had a couple of blips in eight runs for this yard but has won three and runner-up in the other three; career-high mark to deal with (8lb above last win) but trip/ground fine and needs respecting back from a break.

quotes.quote: It was probably a career-best performance from Moodofthemoment. Stan is very strong from the last to the line - there aren't many people who beat Sam Twiston-Davies. We picked him up for 5,500GBP and that's my baseline sort of market. I've only got about 12 in, so to have had five winners this season is pretty good - Matt Sheppard, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He's going to Taunton on Thursday for a 0-120 novice handicap chase. He's been very consistent, winning his last two races, and finishing second the three times before that. Although he's gone up to 106 from a mark of 92 in August, he's definitely got more improvement in him. He's been an absolute bargain. He came out of Ireland with a big reputation - I know David Pipe thought a bit of him, but he didn't cut the mustard there - and I'm excited that he's still unexposed. I'm stepping him up in trip to 2m7f on Thursday because it's an ideal race for him. I'm not sure if he's a true three-miler but he might be okay on a sharp track. I think he'll go on any ground. 28-11-24

runners.name: Salamanca Bay
runners.breeder: D Fenton, Elm Equine & Holling Equine
runners.comment: Perhaps went off a bit too hot when third behind Jet Of Dreams at Chepstow
runners.spotlight: Should be well handicapped and he ran well for a long way when a 4l third behind Jet Of Dreams at Chepstow (2m, good); perhaps went off a bit too hot that day and has to be of interest.

quotes.quote: Salamanca Bay had been a bit keen and I just decided to let him go today. He has a high cruising speed and he handles that ground well. He will improve jumping-wise when he gets a lead in maybe a good handicap - Mikey Fogarty, rider.

stable_tour.quote: He's pretty headstrong but we've done his wind and he should be out in early December. He has some decent form to his name and looks like a two-miler at this stage. 12-11-24

runners.name: Jet Of Dreams
runners.comment: In-form gelding; only 4lb higher than last time and further progress is possible
runners.spotlight: Has won four of his last seven handicap chases; didn't have lots in hand at Chepstow last time (2m, good) but has only been raised 4lb and further progress is possible.

quotes.race: Royal Oak At Hillcommon Novices' Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: That was like a piece of work for Jet Of Dreams. He sometimes goes left anyway and especially when he's in front he's going to do it more so I just left him drift over that way. The things in front of me were the only things that were going to get me beat - James Bowen, jockey, talking to Racing TV.

runners.name: Jolyjump
runners.breeder: Mrs D Saliou & Haras De La Haie Neuve
runners.comment: 1-7 over fences and not the easiest to predict; still ran well last time at Plumpton
runners.spotlight: 1-7 over fences and not the easiest to predict; still ran well last time at Plumpton (2m1f, good; first-time cheekpieces) where his jumping got ragged late on; hard to rule out.

quotes.race: Download The At The Races App Novices' Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: Jolyjump has always looked a nice horse and his jumping was super - Caoilin Quinn, rider.

4:30.race_name: Step Into Luxury With Purple Granite Handicap Hurdle

runners.name: Kiss My Face

prev_owners.owner: D Gilbert, M Lawrence, A Bruce

runners.comment: C&D winner on good ground and put a line through final defeat on heavy
runners.spotlight: Off since December when pulled up on heavy ground; can put a line through that and had been running well, going down narrowly to an in-form horse at Haydock; C&D winner on good ground.

stable_tour.quote: Bought for a bit of summer fun and he's done very well. He's only won once but he's gone up the handicap very quickly. 19-02-25

runners.name: Thankyourluckystar
runners.comment: Course winner over 2m4f; hasn't quite got home over 2m7f/3m the last twice
runners.spotlight: Course winner last June over 2m4f on good ground when only 2lb higher; hasn't quite got home over 2m7f/3m the last twice and might be vulnerable to a stronger stayer.

quotes.race: Racing To School Conditional Jockeys' Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: That was fairly straightforward and it was a lovely ride by Jay [Tidball], he knows the horse very well. It's all coming together for Thankyourluckystar now, he's had a few issues with his feet in the past and he's got his confidence and built from there. It was nice ground there and it helped him, I'd say he'll be better when he goes over fences - Alastair Ralph, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: A consistent sort who hasn't found his feet this time. He's been banging on the door and goes to Ludlow on Wednesday for a 0-120, when we'll probably take a bit of weight off him. He won't be far away from winning now. 19-02-25

runners.name: Sirekoff
runners.comment: Hadn't offered a lot in handicaps until finishing second at Bangor when well backed
runners.spotlight: Maiden hurdle winner who hadn't offered a lot in handicaps until finishing second at Bangor when well backed (2m7f, good to soft); led two out there before folding late on and now goes in cheekpieces; considered.

runners.name: Keppel Queen
runners.comment: Remains a maiden and ran poorly last time but does have competitive form over this far
runners.spotlight: Remains a maiden and ran poorly last time; however, a repeat of her placed efforts at Warwick (3m2f, soft) and Chepstow (2m7f, good) would see her in the mix.

runners.name: Alexandra Larose
runners.comment: Might be high in the weights now and has her stamina to prove over this far
runners.spotlight: Had a break since her hat-trick bid came up well short when odds-on at Hereford in March; however, might be high in the weights now and has her stamina to prove over this far.

runners.name: Zacony Rebel
runners.comment: Not beaten all that far at Ludlow in December but no worthwhile form since then
runners.spotlight: Not beaten all that far at Ludlow in December but no worthwhile form since then and a tongue-tie is added.

runners.name: Rebel Intentions
runners.comment: It's all gone pear-shaped since winning off 2lb higher at Kempton in October
runners.spotlight: It's all gone pear-shaped since winning off 2lb higher at Kempton in October (2m5f, good) and he's been getting his ground; reservations for now.

quotes.race: Grundon Waste Management Conditional Jockeys' Novices' Handicap Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I always thought Rebel Intentions wanted this ground and Joe gave him an absolute peach and won the race from the front. I was going to go back over fences with him but, while he's winning, maybe we will stick over hurdles and see how far he can go - Emma Lavelle, trainer.

runners.name: Thirtyfour Thirty
runners.comment: Well handicapped on last year's peak form but he hasn't been running well of late
runners.spotlight: This time last year he posted back-to-back seconds over 3m2f on good ground at Fontwell and Warwick; well handicapped on that form but he hasn't been running well of late.

runners.name: Marmalade Time
runners.comment: Has won a novice but handicap form has been very forgettable
runners.spotlight: Has won a novice but handicap form has been very forgettable; reservations despite her falling mark.

quotes.race: aceodds.com Bonus Codes EBF Mares' 'National Hunt' Novices' Hurdle (EBF Mares' Qual') (GBB)
quotes.quote: I think the ground was the key, Marmalade Time wouldn't necessarily have a massive turn of foot at the end of a race but she just keeps galloping. So it played right into her hands today. She's still quite green but she's improved run by run - Mel Rowley, trainer.

4:00.race_name: eventmasters.co.uk Mares' Novices' Hurdle (Arc Summer Novices' Brush Hurdle Series Qualifier) (GBB)

runners.name: Jena Doudairies
runners.comment: The only rules winner in this field and penalised accordingly, but the one to beat
runners.spotlight: Bumper winner who confirmed early hurdling promise when a comfortable winner at Chepstow (2m3f, good) and then ran okay to be fifth of 16 in a Cheltenham handicap (2m4f); the only rules winner in this field and penalised accordingly, but the one to beat.

stable_tour.quote: She showed a similar level of form in her three bumpers last season; she failed to get a clear run when getting off the mark at Taunton, so deserves extra credit. She recently sustained a small cut while on the walker, so is still a month to six weeks off a run. She goes mares' novice hurdling. 04-11-24

runners.name: Arctic Blue
runners.comment: Beaten nearly a distance on hurdling debut and has twice pulled up since then
runners.spotlight: Beaten nearly a distance on hurdling debut and has twice pulled up since then; had a wind op and now goes in a tongue-tie; too much to prove.

runners.name: Brooklyn Callin
runners.comment: Going up in trip for hurdling debut is a good thing but others have more pressing claims
runners.spotlight: Irish point winner with a stout pedigree; ran better in her second bumper at Huntingdon a month ago when a sprint finish wouldn't have suited, though she was noticeably weak in the betting (4-1 out to 18s); going up in trip for hurdling debut has to be a good thing but others have more pressing claims.

runners.name: Ciakat
runners.owner: The Cheltenham & South West Racing Club
runners.comment: Placed in Irish points but 0-6 in that scene and has offered little so far over hurdles
runners.spotlight: Placed in Irish points but was 0-6 in that scene and has offered little so far over hurdles, at about 2m3f on good ground.

runners.name: Hard Dealt
runners.comment: Pushed a respected rival with far more experience close at Chepstow
runners.spotlight: Irish point winner who has improved with each run under rules and was clear of the favourite when pushing a respected rival with far more experience close at Chepstow (2m novice, good); thereabouts.

runners.name: Mistletoe
runners.comment: Split the market principals at 125-1 in a 2m5f mares' novice at Fontwell
runners.spotlight: Point bumper winner and left her first two runs under rules behind to split the market principals at 125-1 in a 2m5f mares' novice at Fontwell (good); likely to need further improvement here but that's feasible.

runners.name: Plus Point
runners.owner: Tim Cottier And Razor Ruddock Racing 1

prev_owners.owner: Tim Cottier And Razor Ruddock Racing 1

runners.comment: Given her useful Flat ability she's been quite disappointing in her two races over hurdles
runners.spotlight: Quite useful on the Flat for former yard, winning three times at up to 1m6f; given that ability she's been quite disappointing in her two races over hurdles (at 2-1 and 6-1).

quotes.quote: Newbury was a sort of fact-finding mission and we were pleasantly surprised Plus Point was up to winning over a mile and a quarter. We hoped there was improvement up to a mile and a half but, especially against one of Sir Mark's without a penalty, it was a bit of a question. She did it nicely. We were very much on weather watch. I think probably it was a two-way swing in that Sir Mark didn't want rain and we did. The ground is very much as important a factor to her as the trip. This is her time of year now and I hope she continues to improve - Harry Eustace, trainer.

runners.name: Top Tier Gossip
runners.comment: Second at Stratford and then didn't run badly in a better race at Ascot
runners.spotlight: Promising second of five on Stratford debut (bumper on soft) in October and it was a good race in which she finished last of six at Ascot (1m7f, good) the following month, in which she ran well to a point; respected hurdling debutante.

stable_tour.quote: We were surprised at how green she was when finishing second at Stratford and she'll step forward a good deal when she reappears in a couple of weeks. 12-11-24

5:05.race_name: Worcester Racecourse Ladies Day 7th June Handicap Hurdle (Div I)

runners.name: Sandscape
runners.comment: Second in a novice at Wetherby but pulled up and beaten 20l in his two handicaps
runners.spotlight: Second in a novice at Wetherby but pulled up and beaten 20l in his two handicaps, over 2m4f (soft) and 2m2f (good to soft); has dropped 5lb and it's still relatively early days.

runners.name: Broomfield Gale
runners.comment: Won a weak race last week; the ability is there to defy a penalty but she comes with risks
runners.spotlight: Has ran out before and refused to race, and she didn't look all that keen to take part at Stratford last week but ended up running out the easy winner of a weak event (2m6f, good); the ability is there to defy a penalty but she comes with risks.

runners.name: Chauffeur Driven
runners.comment: Has placed form over hurdles but his best runs have come with plenty of give underfoot
runners.spotlight: Pulled up on chase debut latest; has placed form over hurdles but his best runs have come with give underfoot.

stable_tour.quote: won his only start in Ireland and will probably begin in a bumper in November. He'll probably want a trip in time but has strengthened over the summer. 31-10-23

runners.name: Less Jersey Royal
runners.comment: Well beaten in his handicaps and the blinkers did nothing for him at Uttoxeter
runners.spotlight: Hasn't really threatened in any of his four handicaps and the blinkers did nothing for him at Uttoxeter, albeit over 2m7f.

runners.name: Manala
runners.breeder: J C Haimet &  J P Liberge
runners.comment: Beaten fav on handicap debut but getting back on good ground could be a positive
runners.spotlight: Had a long absence after finishing second in a bumper for Nicky Henderson; well held in maiden/novice events and dropped away to be beaten about 8l when made favourite for handicap debut at Ludlow (2m5f, good to soft); that bumper run was on good ground which she's not encountered since; if that helps then she's a player.

stable_tour.quote: Another with loads of talent, she's attractive and was second when getting the hang of things in her bumper, but a pelvis injury will hold her up. I'd love to see that fixed fairly sharply so she can start over hurdles. 30-10-23

runners.name: Getaway With You
runners.comment: Has threatened and perhaps a change of scenery can bring about a change of luck
runners.spotlight: Now 0-17 over hurdles and his jumping was sketchy when fourth of five at Bangor (2m7f, heavy), though wasn't beaten far; sold for Â£7,000 since; has threatened in the past and perhaps a change of scenery can bring about a change of luck.

runners.name: Jysuis
runners.comment: Made it 0-8 over hurdles when tailed off in a 2m4f handicap on good ground at Sedgefield
runners.spotlight: Maiden under both codes and made it 0-8 over hurdles when tailed off in a 2m4f handicap on good ground at Sedgefield.

runners.name: The Wire Flyer
runners.comment: Easy 66-1 winner last week at Ffos Las; only 3lb higher here despite the penalty
runners.spotlight: Only his second win in 42 career starts when doing it easily last week at Ffos Las (2m4f, good), defying odds of 66-1; that was from out of the weights so only 3lb higher here with a penalty; whether he'll replicate the form is the glaring concern.

runners.name: Clover Pass
runners.comment: Only 2l away when second at Ludlow on Sunday; could have part to play if turned out again
runners.spotlight: Perhaps failed to stay 3m2f when second in a first-time hood at Stratford and again finished second, but a closer one, dropped to 2m5f at Ludlow on Sunday; could have a part to play if turned out again.

3:00.race_name: DragonBet Born From The Betting Ring Open National Hunt Flat Race (Cat 1 Elimination) (GBB) (Div I)

runners.name: Bushstreet Bowman
runners.comment: Second foal; dam unraced sister to point winner Music Of The Morn; respected yard
runners.spotlight: Second foal; dam unraced sister to point winner Music Of The Morn; from a yard that wins plenty of bumpers.

runners.name: Captain Hugo
runners.comment: Bred to stay much further but still went close in a Hereford bumper three weeks ago
runners.spotlight: Bred to stay much further but still went close in a Hereford bumper three weeks ago (good; 100-30) and the winner brought some useful form that day; should improve.

runners.name: Gunar
runners.breeder: The Hon Mrs R Pease & Anthony Boswood
runners.comment: Finished third in a 2m4f Eyton point last month that was declared void
runners.spotlight: Finished third in a 2m4f Eyton point last month that was declared void; did show a bit of ability.

runners.name: Happy Harrison
runners.comment: Had wind surgery since tailed off at Southwell in November; only 12-1 that day
runners.spotlight: Only 12-1 for good-ground debut at Southwell in November but finished tailed off; had wind surgery and now tries a tongue-tie, so may do better.

runners.name: Madajovy
runners.breeder: R F And S D Knipe
runners.comment: Weak 11-2 chance when a 2l third of six on good to soft at Ludlow 20 days ago
runners.spotlight: Weak 11-2 chance when a 2l third of six on good to soft at Ludlow 20 days ago; kept on nicely enough from off the pace.

runners.name: Reckless Spending
runners.owner: Mrs G Van Geest & M George
runners.comment: Couldn't live with the winner in his Irish point but then fetched Â£200,000 at the sales
runners.spotlight: Couldn't live with the winner in his Irish point but then fetched Â£200,000 at the sales; the winner of that point has since finished fourth in a bumper for Gordon Elliott and the third has won a point.

runners.name: Bombay Pete
runners.comment: In third but was beaten when falling late on in a 3m heavy-ground point in Ireland
runners.spotlight: In third but was beaten when falling late on in a 3m heavy-ground point in Ireland; best watched unless backed.

runners.name: Dingdangdoo
runners.comment: First foal out of a bumper and 1m4f Flat winner; stable 1-25 in bumpers recent seasons
runners.spotlight: First foal out of a bumper and 1m4f Flat winner (RPR 79) and sister to useful bumper/2m1f-2m5f hurdle winner Shalone; stable 1-25 in bumpers in recent seasons.

runners.name: Hans Lippershey
runners.comment: Held up and strong through the line when close third of seven on good ground at Huntingdon
runners.spotlight: Held up and strong through the line when a close third of seven on good ground at Huntingdon; RPR recorded that day gives him a fair bit to find.

runners.name: Stung By Tariffs
runners.comment: Boasts a useful jumping pedigree and one to note in the betting
runners.spotlight: Half-brother to winners Lady Of The Night (2m3f hurdle) and Marshmallo (bumper); dam 2m5f chase winner, half-sister to 2m/2m1f chase winner Spinaround, out of unraced half-sister to Grand National winner Party Politics; one to note in the betting.

runners.name: Hey Georgie
runners.comment: Beaten 11l in both his point bumpers this spring; the only filly in this field
runners.spotlight: Beaten 11l in both his point bumpers this spring; the only filly in this field.

5:35.race_name: Worcester Racecourse Ladies Day 7th June Handicap Hurdle (Div II)

runners.name: Ivane
runners.breeder: E A R L Trinquet & M & O Trinquet
runners.owner: A Keaveney, M Keaveney & P Butcher
runners.comment: Has run well in four starts over hurdles/fences since joining this yard; major player
runners.spotlight: Has run well in four starts over hurdles/fences since joining this yard in March (2123), the latest when third of seven finishers over hurdles at Bangor (2m4f, good to soft) 19 days ago; wouldn't have a problem were the ground to ease and a major player.

runners.name: Kap De Triomphe
runners.breeder: P Mehat & B Mehat & C Lemeunier
runners.comment: Out of the frame in six starts over hurdles since joining yard; 3lb drop doesn't tempt
runners.spotlight: Irish bumper winner who has finished out of the frame in six starts over hurdles since joining this yard; another 3lb drop not enough to tempt.

runners.name: Our Lil
runners.owner: Paddy Brennan Racing Syndicate Our Lil
runners.comment: Out of her depth last time, but won the time before and respected back in calmer waters
runners.spotlight: Won a novice hurdle at Doncaster (2m1f, good; first start since wind surgery) in March, but faced a stiff task from 9lb out of the weights on handicap debut at Cheltenham (2m1f, good) last month; wouldn't want the ground to ease too much, but respected otherwise.

stable_tour.quote: She ran a nice race at Warwick but jumped a little big and will improve for the run. I think that as a filly she'll be progressive in juvenile hurdles this season. She ran a nice race at Warwick but jumped a little big and will improve for the run. I think that as a filly she'll be progressive in juvenile hurdles this season. 12-11-24

runners.name: Little Pi
runners.comment: Held since winning twice in the winter of 2023-24 and was behind Ivane last time
runners.spotlight: Won twice for Matt Sheppard (1m7f/2m, good to soft) in the winter of 2023-24, but held since including in four starts for this yard; finished about 4l behind Ivane when fifth of seven finishers at Bangor (2m4f, good to soft; first-time tongue-tie) 19 days ago; needs a bit more.

runners.name: Basman Palace
runners.comment: Won at Wincanton in March but held over 3m last time; return to this trip should suit
runners.spotlight: Off the mark at the 13th attempt under rules at Wincanton (2m4f, good) in March, but finished a well-held fourth of seven at Taunton (3m, good to firm) last month; return to this trip should suit and one for the shortlist.

runners.name: Orange Diamond
runners.comment: Has failed to complete in seven of his nine starts for this yard; tongue-tie on
runners.spotlight: Dual winner over hurdles in France, but has failed to complete in seven of his nine starts over hurdles/fences since joining this yard; tongue-tie given a go but a leap of faith is still required.

runners.name: Hey Mister Dj
runners.comment: Returning from over a year off when second at Fontwell last month; longer trip should suit
runners.spotlight: 0-8 under rules, but was returning from over a year off when second of nine on stable debut at Fontwell (2m2f, good) last month; the longer trip looks to be in his favour and a contender if taking a step forward.

runners.name: Pub Crawl

prev_owners.owner: Mrs I Corbani & Mrs E O'Leary

runners.comment: Well held on last month's return and is now 0-26 under rules; others more convincing
runners.spotlight: 1lb lower than when second of six at Sedgefield (2m1f, good to soft) last October, but well held on last month's return over the same C&D (good) and is now 0-26 under rules; others more convincing.

runners.name: Noble Recall
runners.comment: Well held in two bumpers and four starts over hurdles; 5lb out of the weights
runners.spotlight: Well held in two bumpers and four starts over hurdles; little appeal from 5lb out of the weights.

3:30.race_name: DragonBet Born From The Betting Ring Open National Hunt Flat Race (Cat 1 Elimination) (GBB) (Div II)

runners.name: Benjimun Bunnie
runners.comment: Half-brother to bumper, 2m hurdle and 2m4f chase winner Runswick Bay; non-runner
runners.spotlight: Half-brother to bumper, 2m hurdle and 2m4f chase winner Runswick Bay; dam unraced half-sister to chase and bumper winners; yard 0-5 in these races in recent seasons; non-runner.

runners.name: Coastal Command
runners.owner: Hm The King & Hm The Queen
runners.comment: He's of obvious interest given pedigree and connections
runners.spotlight: Eighth foal; half-brother to winners Sunshade (useful bumper/2m-2m4f hurdle), Rapid Flight (useful 2m4f-3m1f hurdle/chase) and Climbing (2m4f chase); dam unraced half-sister to bumper and smart 2m-2m4f hurdle/chase winner Close Touch; he's of obvious interest given pedigree and connections.

runners.name: Fanny Moon
runners.breeder: E A R L Haras De La Haie Neuve
runners.comment: Only 7-1 at Wetherby (good) but was always out the back and finished tailed off
runners.spotlight: Only 7-1 at Wetherby (good) but was always out the back and finished tailed off.

runners.name: Ice In The Veins
runners.comment: Second at Warwick behind a surprise winner who got first run on him
runners.spotlight: 87,000euros 3yo; the surprise winner got first run on him at Warwick (good; 12-1) but that was a promising start and Harry Skelton takes over here.

runners.name: Gaelic Glow
runners.comment: This 4yo looked threatening at Uttoxeter until fading late on; can build on that
runners.spotlight: Stable did well in bumpers last season and this 4yo looked threatening at Uttoxeter until fading late on (2m, good; beaten 7l; 25-1); that's something to build on.

runners.name: Mini Mario
runners.breeder: Elms Bloodstock & Miss A Gibson Fleming
runners.comment: Lost his place mid-race and was beaten 23l at Uttoxeter, finishing behind Gaelic Glow
runners.spotlight: Lost his place mid-race and was beaten 23l at Uttoxeter, finishing behind Gaelic Glow; needs to leave that run behind.

runners.name: Paddy The Baddy
runners.comment: Flat bred and a rare bumper runner for the yard
runners.spotlight: Half-brother to 7f winner Spartakos (RPR 57); dam 6f/7f AW winner (81); Flat bred and a rare bumper runner for the yard.

runners.name: Colour Clash
runners.comment: 1,000euros 3yo; beaten about 20l in a four-runner race at Taunton (good to firm)
runners.spotlight: 1,000euros 3yo; beaten about 20l in a four-runner race at Taunton (good to firm) and opposable on the back of that effort.

runners.name: Lyrical Choice
runners.comment: 54,000euros 3yo; bred to have a future and this 4yo filly gets all the allowances
runners.spotlight: 54,000euros 3yo; sixth foal; half-sister to useful winners Frontal Assault (2m6f-3m hurdle/chase), The Folkes Tiara (2m1f chase/2m2f hurdle) and Riskintheground (2m4f/2m5f hurdle/chase); dam 2m hurdle/chase winner; bred to have a future and this 4yo filly gets all the allowances.

runners.name: Silver Gale
runners.comment: Cost 4,000euros as a 3yo; finished well for third in a point bumper at Bitterley
runners.spotlight: Cost 4,000euros as a 3yo; finished well for third in a point bumper at Bitterley (good to firm); wouldn't be the obvious answer to this.

3:20.race_name: Tea & Biscuits Woohoo At Lucas Bookies Handicap (Chepstow Mile Series Qualifier)
3:20.going_detailed: GOOD (Good to firm in places; 7.1; watered)

runners.name: Next Trick
runners.comment: Not built on a promising stable debut in January (1m, AW); enough to prove for now
runners.spotlight: 13-race maiden; ran well off an 8lb higher mark on her stable debut in January (1m, AW) but she has been disappointing since, including back on turf latest; others look stronger.

runners.name: Johnjay
runners.comment: Infrequent winner but capable at this level; could probably do with some rain though
runners.spotlight: Made a winning handicap and stable debut at Bath in April 2023 (1m, soft); hasn't added to it in 11 further outings but he has often run well, including first time out last season; fast ground would be a concern but otherwise he has plenty to recommend him at this level.

runners.name: Outrace
runners.comment: Back in form when 3rd at Bath last week; dangerous mark if building on it; can front run
runners.spotlight: Put some quiet runs behind him when third of ten at Bath last week (1m, firm); on a dangerous mark if he can build on it and it will be interesting to see if he's ridden more positively this afternoon (all three wins when either making all or racing prominently).

runners.name: Happy Chandler
runners.comment: 0-7 and not progressing in handicaps; cheekpieces now tried
runners.spotlight: Seven-race maiden; modest form in handicaps so far, including on last month's seasonal return, and the addition of cheekpieces needs to have a galvanising effect.

runners.name: Dogged
runners.breeder: Whitsbury Manor Stud And Mrs M E Slade

prev_owners.owner: D Elsworth,M Elliott & Ten Green Bottles

runners.comment: On a handy mark but 1m on fast ground perhaps an insufficient test nowadays; stable debut
runners.spotlight: Should be well treated but he ran poorly in his only run for Daniel Steele when last seen in December; 1m on fast ground perhaps inadequate nowadays; stable debut.

quotes.race: First Call Traffic Management Nursery Handicap
quotes.quote: Dogged did that well from stall one and is a horse on the up. He rolled down the hill into the Dip but galloped out very well - Tom Marquand, jockey.

runners.name: Dappled Light
runners.comment: Last month's return was encouraging enough and he has finished 2nd in both C&D runs; solid
runners.spotlight: Won twice last year and also ran well in defeat over C&D; only sixth on his return to action at Wolverhampton last month but he met some trouble in running at a crucial stage; high on the list.

runners.name: Port Noir
runners.breeder: R C Dollar & Hellwood Stud Farm
runners.comment: Below par last time but she had been running well prior to that; two course wins; chance
runners.spotlight: Never featured at Wolverhampton three weeks ago but she had been in good form prior to that effort and she is feasibly weighted; has won twice here in the past and she's an each-way contender.

runners.name: Glencalvie
runners.comment: Down in weights and there was more promise tried in cheekpieces last time; not ruled out
runners.spotlight: None too consistent but she's slipped to a basement mark and there was more encouragement to be gleaned when a close fourth at Nottingham last month (first-time cheekpieces, retained); 11lb lower than for her Yarmouth win 13 months ago so needs a second look.

runners.name: Letter Of The Law
runners.comment: No show on AW this spring but should prove a different proposition back over 1m & on turf
runners.spotlight: Two wins last year, including C&D, and two 7f AW runs this spring aren't the ones to judge him on (huge prices and now 0-15 on AW); better expected back up in trip and returned to grass and he has the assistance of talented 7lb claimer Jack Dace in the saddle.

runners.name: Royal Justice
runners.comment: Yet to build on her fair stable debut; best turf form has come on slower than good
runners.spotlight: Best turf form for the Quinns came on slow ground; fair start for new yard in February (7f, AW) but less good twice since; others look safer.

runners.name: Glen Esk
runners.comment: Dropped to a basement mark but as a result of offering little for his current stable
runners.spotlight: Little to enthuse about in his time with current yard after a lengthy absence; too much to prove.

quotes.quote: Glen Esk is a big unit and he's strengthened up a bit from last year. As he's a big horse I thought he might need the race and hopefully we can build on that through the year. There might be a nice little race to win with him further down the line - winning trainer Chris Wall.

stable_tour.quote: He was slow to come to hand this spring but we finally got him out at Yarmouth early this month when he ran a cracker to finish a neck second over a mile. We took him to Windsor on Sunday over 1m2f as he's a more mature horse this year and I thought he was properly ready for the trip, and he won well by three and a quarter lengths off a mark of 63. 30-06-21

4:20.race_name: David Lucas Top Price On Welsh Sport Handicap
4:20.going_detailed: GOOD (Good to firm in places; 7.1; watered)

runners.name: Mojomaker
runners.comment: Poor strike-rate but capable at this level and Rossa Ryan back in the saddle; blinkers off
runners.spotlight: Losing run up to 28 but he has run three solid races since returning to turf last month; Rossa Ryan back on board and set to go well again; blinkers left off this time.

quotes.race: British Stallion Studs EBF Novice Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: We always thought a lot of Mojomaker and there was a reason we took him to the Lily Agnes first time out at Chester as we thought he was good enough to win there. He didn't handle the track on the day but he left that well and truly behind at Goodwood last time. I think he should have won but he threw the race away. He can hang a bit and be a bit of a lad but we put a new bit on his bridle today and it has worked a treat. Pat (Cosgrave, jockey) got off him at Goodwood and said he would love to run him over five furlongs at Sandown. We were very bullish coming down. There is a Listed race back here next month and we will probably look at something like that ahead of the Molecomb at Goodwood - David Loughnane, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He was consistent last year, winning a Sandown novice over 5f as well as running some other good races. We had him gelded in the spring and the improvement is noticeable at home. He returned to action at Doncaster last month and was desperately unlucky not to win as he was in front a stride before and after the line, but not on the line. He has gone up 3lb for that effort, which I'm sure he'll handle as I think he'll progress into a black-type horse. 11-05-22

runners.name: Macs Dilemma
runners.comment: Multiple course winner; fair mark if ready to roll after an absence; new headgear
runners.spotlight: Four course wins, including this race in 2022; drawn a blank since July 2023 but well treated on even last season's best; hood fitted for reappearance.

runners.name: Connies Rose
runners.comment: Yet to fire in two 5f runs this year (after wind op); down in the weights but others safer
runners.spotlight: Had wind surgery over the winter but it's yet to have a positive impact, only beating two rivals home in two 5f handicaps at Bath last month; becoming well treated but others appeal more for the win.

quotes.quote: Connie's Rose loves racing - there is no mare tougher.  She has a good routine at home - she doesn't do a lot or see another horse - and she's a joy to train.  I'm still undecided if she prefers 5f.  We thought she was going to be a 1m-plus horse as she was slow, green and didn't know how to gallop at all, but she got a lot quicker at home.  Would we get more improvement holding her up at 1m?  We don't know.  We may try it in future but we don't want to change anything that's working at the moment - Grace Harris, trainer, speaking to Racing TV.

runners.name: Bear Rock
runners.comment: Improved for handicapping on turf the last twice; still well treated; can progress again
runners.spotlight: Ran well in minor novice/maiden company on AW and improved for the switch to turf handicaps, fourth of 17 at Doncaster (5f, good) before beating 16 rivals at Haydock 17 days ago (6f, good); having the stand rail to help was beneficial there but a 3lb rise looks fair and she's high on the list.

runners.name: Monkey Miss
runners.comment: Three wins last year, the last two over 7f; drop to 6f could find her out on stable debut
runners.spotlight: Won three handicaps for the Kublers last season, including at this track (7f); soft ground a valid excuse for her low-key end to 2024; drops back in trip for her stable debut (same owner) after eight months off and it could be sharp enough for her.

runners.name: Saffredi
runners.comment: Progressive since dropped back in trip by new yard; fast turf a query but still considered
runners.spotlight: Prominent racer who is on the up for his new yard, winning a 6f handicap at Wolverhampton last October and scoring over that same C&D on his return last month; only third off this mark last time but it was still a fine run given he was too free; more to prove on fast turf but he remains unexposed as a sprinter.

runners.name: Francisco
runners.breeder: Alvediston Stud & Mrs R M Wardall
runners.comment: Slow starter; managed to win a 7f AW event last month but likely vulnerable back at 6f
runners.spotlight: Overcame his usual slow start when winning a 7f handicap at Wolverhampton for this apprentice Alfie Redman 17 days ago; has the ability to deal with a 2lb rise and he should get a good pace to aim at but conceding so much ground at the start will mean he always carries risk.

runners.name: Vaunted
runners.comment: C&D success last August was one of three wins in 2024; down the field on return; e-w shout
runners.spotlight: Three wins in the second half of 2024, the first over C&D; down the field on Haydock reappearance 17 days ago but she met some trouble and didn't have a hard race in the closing stages; stable also runs Ten Club.

quotes.quote: Vaunted tries her heart out. She didn't get a run last time, she wouldn't have won but she'd have been second - Nigel Tinkler, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: Won at Bath, so I'm really pleased and hopefully it's a sign we've a smashing bunch to look forward to. She came out of the race well. Whiles he is professional, she wasn't harried to be there and will progress. Early-season form is tricky to piece together, but she is a nice prospect. 22-04-21

They went a fair gallop when she won at Pontefract two starts ago and probably stopped in front of her. It might have made her look better than she was, but she's a lovely filly and proved that when only narrowly beaten at Newmarket on Saturday. I was very pleased with that. The track suited her on Saturday and, like many of mine, she's very genuine. We'll try to keep her in those fillies-only races over the summer. 27-07-22

runners.name: Ten Club
runners.comment: Improving with each AW run for new stable but he has much more to prove back on the grass
runners.spotlight: Poor form in two turf runs for Jamie Osborne but he won twice on AW, the latest last September off 3lb higher; has improved run by run for his new stable but the switch to turf is a query.

runners.name: Vape
runners.comment: Won this race in 2023 off 10lb higher; can go well fresh; contender off his handy mark
runners.spotlight: Won the corresponding race in 2023 off a 10lb higher mark; added another C&D win to his haul last July off 2lb higher; can go well fresh and resumes on a good mark so he needs consideration.

quotes.race: Download The At The Races App Handicap
quotes.quote: I was concerned about the ground for Vape as I wanted it quicker. Perhaps we'll have a go on the all-weather now unless we can find decent ground on turf. He tries his best and is a pleasure to train. I know he played up at Chepstow last time and was withdrawn, but I don't think it was truly his fault - John Flint, trainer.

quotes.race: Download The At The Races App Handicap (Div I)
quotes.quote: I fancied Vape. I think we had some bad luck at Chelmsford last time. I didn't realise how important it was for the blinds to stay on until the last minute. We took them off early and he chanced the stalls and we got left. The winner scooted in that day, but I felt we'd have been in the frame, and coming back to six furlongs on ground softer than good was ideal. He's nice. He's big, but can go on good to firm, so hopefully we can get one or two more wins out of him - John Flint, trainer.

runners.name: Moes Legacy
runners.comment: Back to her last winning mark; conditions no problem and sharper for recent return
runners.spotlight: Not straightforward but she is capable on her day and is back to her last winning mark; recent Wolverhampton run should have sharpened her up and she's effective at this track; not discounted.

runners.name: Bama Lama
runners.comment: Conditions fine and on a winning mark but she's enjoyed all her success at Class 6 level
runners.spotlight: C&D win last June came off 5lb lower; added further successes at Ffos Las and Windsor and she looks ready for a return to 6f after two seventh-place finishes over 5f last month; 0-7 out of Class 6 company though (and placed only once).

stable_tour.quote: She's probably one of our lower-rated horses but she's very genuine in her grade and she normally wins one or two races every season. She was only beaten a neck at Windsor last time and is very consistent. She gives her owner- who is very enthusiastic and who also bred her- a lot of fun. She'll run ten or 12 times a season and is always knocking on the door. 11-07-24

runners.name: Radiant Angel
runners.comment: 6f AW win in February; not at best on turf the last twice
runners.spotlight: Things fell into place for him at Wolverhampton (6f) in February and also second at that track last month; two recent turf runs leave him with more to prove though.

2:50.race_name: Guaranteed Odds At David Lucas Bookmakers / EBF Restricted Maiden Stakes (GBB/IRE Incentive Race)
2:50.going_detailed: GOOD (Good to firm in places; 7.1; watered)

runners.name: Born Slippy
runners.comment: Prominent in the betting but weakened into fourth on AW debut; can do better
runners.spotlight: Sent off the 2-1 second favourite for his Wolverhampton debut six weeks ago but dropped away having shown speed; could leave that behind him and it will be interesting to see if his backers return switched to turf.

runners.name: Steel Drum
runners.comment: 35,000euros half-brother to 3 winners over 1m+; yard's 2yos up and running; check betting
runners.spotlight: April foal; 35,000euros yearling; sixth foal; half-brother to winners La Tihaty (7f/1m AW; RPR 108), Push The Limit (1m AW 2yo; 92) and Stellarmasterpiece (1m1f/1m4f; 65); dam French 1m3f winner; wears cheekpieces on debut; yard's 2yos up and running and he's worth a market check, for all he'll appreciate 6f when the time comes.

runners.name: Torbay
runners.comment: Dam a useful 6f/7f winner; yard going well but not known for 2yo success
runners.spotlight: March foal; third foal of a 6f 2yo/7f AW winner (RPR 95); likely type on paper and stable going well but they aren't renowned for 2yo success (0-14 but six placed in the last five seasons).

runners.name: Will He Shine
runners.comment: May foal; minor appeal on paper and yard not a regular source of 2yo success
runners.spotlight: May foal; fifth foal; closely related to 1m-1m2f AW winner Danehill Star (RPR 65); dam 7f-1m2f maiden (66); stable has few 2yo winners and others bring much more compelling paper claims.

runners.name: Angel Numbers
runners.comment: 50,000gns yearling; dam a 6f 2yo winner; had wind op prior to debut; tongue tied
runners.spotlight: February foal; 50,000gns yearling; first foal of a 6f AW 2yo winner (RPR 85), herself from a useful family; enough paper appeal to warrant a market check but she's already had a wind op and wears a tongue tie on debut.

runners.name: Could Be The Move
runners.comment: Behind Born Slippy on her debut six weeks ago (5f, AW); improvement a must
runners.spotlight: Finished one place and 1.25l behind Born Slippy when fifth at Wolverhampton on her debut six weeks ago (20-1); improvement needed to beat that rival, let alone the newcomers.

runners.name: Sinj
runners.comment: Second foal of a 5f winner (RPR 94); powerful 2yo yard; lots to like on paper
runners.spotlight: March foal; second foal of a 5f winner (including 2yo/AW; RPR 94); sire gets sprint winners, for all she'll likely stay further, and she's from a powerful 2yo yard; has more to recommend her than many.

runners.name: Brightling
runners.comment: Debut effort (5f, AW) not without promise and yard's juveniles tend to improve for a run
runners.spotlight: Kempton debut effort five weeks ago wasn't without promise and her stable's juveniles tend to progress with experience; could take a good step forward switched to turf.

runners.name: Our Cody
runners.owner: Mrs J Woods R P Gallagher & Partner

prev_owners.owner: Mrs J Woods R P Gallagher & Partner

runners.comment: Â£3,000 yearling; half-sister to a winner in Italy; betting to guide
runners.spotlight: March foal; Â£3,000 yearling; second foal; half-sister to Italian 6f 2yo winner Wangari; dam 7f-1m1f maiden; stable off the mark with 2yos and she needs a look in the betting.

4:55.going_detailed: GOOD (Good to firm in places; 7.1; watered)

runners.name: Forest Spirit
runners.owner: Mrs G Rowland Clark & J Oconnor
runners.comment: Both wins on AW but ran well when third on turf last time; respected down 1lb
runners.spotlight: Won twice over 1m4f on the AW in March and showed she could handle turf when third of eight at Windsor (11.4f, good to firm) 15 days ago; the return to this slightly longer trip should suit and she's respected down 1lb.

runners.name: Sun Tracker

prev_owners.owner: Exors Of The Late K Abdullah

runners.comment: Regressive in seven starts on the AW for this yard; off five months and may need it
runners.spotlight: 1-4 on turf in France but regressive in seven starts on the AW for this yard; returns to grass after five months off and he may need it.

runners.name: Seraphic
runners.comment: Won at Brighton on penultimate start and has won over this far on AW; shortlisted
runners.spotlight: Hasn't been with this yard for long; held over hurdles ten days ago, but had previously got the better of a subsequent winner on the Flat at Brighton (1m2f, good to firm); has won over this far on the AW and one for the shortlist.

runners.name: Jenson Benson
runners.comment: Losing run up to 21 and hasn't appeared to stay in his few previous goes over this far
runners.spotlight: All four win over 7f-1m2f on Chelmsford AW; losing run up to 21 and hasn't appeared to stay in his few previous goes over this far; others preferred.

runners.name: Boy George
runners.comment: C&D winner who is proven fresh and just 1lb above last winning mark; could go well
runners.spotlight: C&D winner who hasn't been seen in 162 days, but he has been successful after a much longer absence; just 1lb above his last winning mark and could go well.

quotes.race: Bet Â£20 Get Â£20 With DragonBet Handicap (Bath Summer Stayers' Series Qualifier)
quotes.quote: Boy George had a little tendon injury. We gave him some time off, he came back late but he's been in good form. We thought he might need it but he ran very fresh - Dominic Ffrench Davis, trainer.

runners.name: Angel On High
runners.comment: Fourth on his return at Bath last month, but a record of 2-35 sounds a note of caution
runners.spotlight: Fair effort when fourth of nine on his return from 212 days off at Bath (11.6f, good to firm) last month (winner has gone in again three times since), but a record of 2-35 sounds a note of caution.

quotes.quote: Relieved is the word - Angel On High has been a little bit frustrating. It's been tough getting to this point and I could scarcely believe he came fifth last time. Maybe the drop back in trip helped him today. His previous form looks like he wants a mile and a half but he's such a strong traveller - perhaps we were barking up the wrong tree with that. He isn't a monkey this horse, he has just had a few issues and maybe he thinks about them a bit. His confidence has been growing the past few months and that will do him the world of good. He had every excuse to down tools but he was very brave - Adrian Wintle, trainer.

runners.name: Innisfree Pearl
runners.comment: Won on soft ground at Brighton last September; something to prove if ground remains fast
runners.spotlight: Unraced at two; off the mark at the fifth attempt at Brighton (1m4f, soft) last September; the race didn't pan out her way on last month's Lingfield return (1m4f, AW) but she has something to prove if the ground remains fast.

runners.name: Ladypacksapunch

prev_owners.owner: M Clarke, J Devine, P Munnelly & A Regan

runners.comment: Bath regular who is 1-37; others more convincing
runners.spotlight: Usually seen at Bath and just 1lb higher than when winning there (11.6f, firm) last August, but that her only success in 37 starts and she's been in and out since; others more convincing.

3:50.race_name: Why Bet Elsewhere, David Lucas Bookmakers Handicap
3:50.going_detailed: GOOD (Good to firm in places; 7.1; watered)

runners.name: Romanovich
runners.owner: Mrs S M Maine & Roger Gould
runners.comment: C&D win last year; finished fast for 2nd at Wolverhampton when last seen; big player
runners.spotlight: Three wins in 2024, including C&D, and he ran his best race of this campaign when a close second at Wolverhampton nine weeks ago (7f); 1lb rise manageable and he's a leading contender.

runners.name: Expecto
runners.comment: Well beaten in two runs for her new stable this spring; lots to prove for now
runners.spotlight: Of interest on her best form for Jim Bolger but she's finished well beaten in two starts for new connections this spring; lots to prove for now.

runners.name: Devasboy
runners.comment: On a long losing run but his Wolverhampton 3rd eight weeks ago was promising; contender
runners.spotlight: Without a win since June 2022 but he's down in the weights and his latest third at Wolverhampton (7f) was promising; fine on fast turf and should get a good pace to aim at here; more appealing than many.

runners.name: Ravenglass
runners.comment: Not at best the last twice but in good form prior to that; one of two runners for the yard
runners.spotlight: Not seen to best effect the last twice but prior to that he had been first and second in 7f handicaps at Wolverhampton; one of two runners for the stable and the betting can provide clues.

runners.name: My Clementine
runners.comment: C&D winner last summer; dangerous mark if ready to go after absence; check the betting
runners.spotlight: Off the mark when recording a decisive win over C&D last July (good to soft; cheekpieces first time) and registered a higher RPR when second over C&D two weeks later; mixed record afterwards and returns from 204 days off; dangerous mark if ready to roll though and she needs a market check; stable also runs Ravenglass

runners.name: Embarked
runners.comment: Infrequent winner but he's coming here in good form and should make another bold bid
runners.spotlight: Prominent racer; infrequent winner but he comes here having run well in each of his last four starts, the latest when third at Doncaster (1m, good to firm) 17 days ago; all his wins have come at 7f so dropping back a furlong not an issue.

runners.name: Too Much Trevor
runners.breeder: Moyns Park Estate And Stud Ltd
runners.comment: Exposed maiden who is yet to fire for new connections; enough to prove for now
runners.spotlight: 14-race maiden who has finished out of the money in two runs for his new yard this year; visor the headgear of choice this afternoon.

stable_tour.quote: He was second on his debut at Leicester in a three-horse race, but that doesn't tell the story. He was very slowly away and lost several lengths yet still managed to run on and get second once the penny dropped. I am not saying he would have beaten the winner but he would have been much closer. 10-05-23

runners.name: Ajrad
runners.comment: First and third in two course runs; in form on AW this year; shouldn't be too far away
runners.spotlight: Won a minor 7f handicap on AW in January and not beaten far on his last three starts; first and third in two visits to Chepstow so a good run should be forthcoming; cheekpieces back on today.

stable_tour.quote: He's only just joined us- he's a horse who appeared to be hard to win with and the owners sent him to us for a change of scenery. We've only had him a few weeks and so it'll be interesting how we'll get on with him. He's a 7f-1m horse. 11-07-24

runners.name: Fact Or Fable
runners.owner: Mrs Wendy Jarrett & J S Moore
runners.comment: Conditions to suit, on a good mark and interesting with D Probert replacing apprentices
runners.spotlight: Conditions to suit (four course wins) and he is 5lb lower than for his last success (1m, good to firm; nine months ago); retained ability on AW over the winter; interesting with David Probert taking over (apprentice-ridden on last 14 starts).

stable_tour.quote: I've got two lovely old campaigners who are half-brothers - Fact Or Fable and Uther Pendragon. Between the two of them, they've won just short of Â£200,000 in prize-money. They always turn up and probably on the days you'd don't expect them to win, they do. They're characters in the yard and keep everybody on their toes who rides them. They're owned by the same people - Wendy and Stuart Jarrett - who get so much fun out of it. It's what the game's about. Wendy and Stuart have point-to-pointers as well and they absolutely love their racing. They come from the Bath area and that's why, when you see them, they'll always turn up at Bath and Chepstow. They're the sort of owners racing needs, who are in it just for the love of the sport. 04-07-24

runners.name: Olympic Quest
runners.comment: Not at best on AW this year and her turf form leaves her with plenty to find
runners.spotlight: Has a good chance if reproducing her AW best but she's not shone in that sphere in 2025 and she was again well beaten on turf at Bath last week; drops back to 7f with something to prove.

runners.name: Marisitta
runners.comment: Exposed 13-race maiden; the return of cheekpieces isn't enough to tempt this time
runners.spotlight: Unplaced in all 13 starts; modest form this year and others bring more pressing claims; cheekpieces return.

runners.name: Diamond Cottage
runners.comment: Just touched off at Salisbury nine days ago (6f); C&D winner; each-way claims again
runners.spotlight: Just touched off by her brother Fishermans Cottage (runs in the 2.20) at Salisbury (6f, good to firm) nine days ago; no win since June 2023 but conditions will suit and she's not ruled out.

runners.name: Dynamite Katie
runners.comment: Twice second over C&D last season but opposable after a low-key return two weeks ago
runners.spotlight: Her losing run stands at 21 but she ran some good races over C&D last year; usual hood was absent when well beaten on her return to action two weeks ago and it remains off today.

runners.name: Peachey Carnehan
runners.breeder: J M Duggan & The Late  T Duggan
runners.comment: Veteran who wasn't in much form on AW early in the year
runners.spotlight: Prolific winner down the years, including two here, but he wasn't in much form on AW early in the year.

quotes.quote: They went a good pace which was good as if they'd dawdled I would have been in trouble as Peachey Carnehan missed the break - James Sullivan

quotes.race: Sri Lanka The Wonder Of Asia Handicap
quotes.quote: Peachey Carnehan was unlucky not to win last time and, with his rating, we had to run today. I've just freshened him up and he's been running well. That's three quick runs now so he'll have a break - Michael Mullineaux, trainer.
Peachey Carnehan in good shape and improved a little bit from last week. That's his trip as a mile would stretch him - Adam Kirby, jockey.

2:20.race_name: David Lucas Treble Odds Lucky 15S Handicap
2:20.going_detailed: GOOD (Good to firm in places; 7.1; watered)

runners.name: Professor Tickle
runners.comment: Two runs for current stable need bettering; change of headgear not enough to tempt
runners.spotlight: Down in the weights but last week's fifth of eight at Bath (5f, firm) didn't mark him down as a winner in waiting; visor now given a go.

stable_tour.quote: He's rock-solid and a bit of a dude. He's as honest as the day is long and he'll win his two or three races every year. He's strengthened up loads and could have a few pounds up his sleeve. He's probably a few weeks away from a run. 30-05-24

runners.name: Savannah Smiles
runners.comment: Not at best when last seen and 5f a query; good mark though and Rossa Ryan booked
runners.spotlight: Two of her wins last year came at this track and she's 3lb lower than for her latest success; 5f is something of a question mark but Rossa Ryan is a positive booking for the yard and she can't be ruled out.

quotes.race: In Memory Of Late Sylvia Taylor Handicap
quotes.quote: Savannah Smiles was brilliant and it was a really good win - she's blossomed this year! We bought her last summer and she didn't really do an awful lot, so we gave her a break and she's come back a different horse. She's kept her form all the way through the all-weather and I thought I'd give her another go on the turf and she's never looked back - Grace Harris, trainer.

runners.name: Wedgewood
runners.comment: Better on AW but handicapped accordingly (6lb lower than for recent win); one to consider
runners.spotlight: Often front-runs; strike-rate much better on AW than turf but 5f on fast ground holds no terrors and she comes here on the back of a Wolverhampton win two weeks ago; can race off a 6lb lower mark today and should go well.

runners.name: Glamorous Joy
runners.comment: Salisbury win last summer (5f) off 3lb lower; makes stable debut after seven-month absence
runners.spotlight: Had shown promise in defeat before breaking her duck at Salisbury last July (5f, good to firm); came up short in three subsequent runs and now returns for a new stable (same owners); others appeal more.

runners.name: Darkened Edge
runners.comment: Bath win (5f, firm) last summer and also ran well over C&D; absence to defy; may do better
runners.spotlight: Her only win came in a three-runner affair at Bath last August (5f, firm) but she was placed in three of her next five starts, including C&D; absent for 148 days but could progress again this year.

runners.name: Street Life
runners.owner: Pat Morris And Clear Cut Racing
runners.comment: Solid placed efforts on AW the last twice; ran well over C&D last summer; contender
runners.spotlight: Solid placed efforts on AW the last twice and the return to fast turf won't bother him; ran well in one course run last June; one to consider.

quotes.race: Sky Bet Sunday Apprentice Training Series Handicap (Part Of The Racing Excellence Initiative)
quotes.quote: I let Street Life bowl along and as soon as I asked him, he just took off. Last time I rode him, he missed the break and it was game over. He was a lot more relaxed in the stalls - Morgan Cole, rider.

quotes.race: Ladbrokes Where The Nation Plays Handicap
quotes.quote: He has done it well. STREET LIFE was away really well and jumped the best of them. He travelled as well, whereas before he was always lazy in his racing. He put it to bed well - Sean Davis, jockey

runners.name: Fishermans Cottage
runners.comment: Made a winning reappearance over 6f nine days ago; not well in under a penalty
runners.spotlight: Off the mark at the tenth attempt when beating his sister Diamond Cottage by a short head at Salisbury nine days ago (6f, good  to firm); drop to 5f should be fine but not obviously well in under a 5lb penalty

runners.name: Coco Hill

prev_owners.owner: Mrs T Burns And B R Millman

runners.comment: Two fair runs for new yard in March (6f, AW); down in trip but others appeal more
runners.spotlight: Ex-Irish mare; two respectable efforts for her new yard in March but they came in uncompetitive 0-50 classified events; drops back in trip and could prove vulnerable again.

5:40.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to firm in places (GoingStick: 7.6) (Watering) (Rail Movements: 6.10 & 7.10 -79yds and 7.40 & 8.10 -68yds)

runners.name: Art Of Diplomacy

prev_owners.owner: Imperial Racing, J Blackburn & P Scott

runners.comment: Not at best on latest outing but was largely in good form otherwise last season
runners.spotlight: Disappointing favourite when well-held fourth at Ffos Las last month but was largely in good form otherwise last term; versatile regarding trip/ground and current mark is workable; tough nut to crack if back on song.

runners.name: Jackpot Cash
runners.comment: 3-6 for current stable (including C&D win); second off 5lb higher over hurdles last week
runners.spotlight: C&D chase and dual hurdle winner from just six runs for James Owen since February; close second in competitive Worcester hurdle (2m4f, good) a week ago, despite a significant jumping error, and reverts to chasing on 5lb lower mark; makes obvious appeal.

runners.name: Zero Tolerance
runners.comment: 0-5 over fences last season but ran some good races in defeat; hard to discard
runners.spotlight: 0-5 over fences last season but ran some good races in defeat, most recently when dropped back to 2m4f at Uttoxeter (good to soft) in March; not sure to be suited by the faster ground here but hard to discard.

6:10.race_name: Canine Premier Flex Plus Joint Supplement Maiden Hurdle (GBB Race)
6:10.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to firm in places (GoingStick: 7.6) (Watering) (Rail Movements: 6.10 & 7.10 -79yds and 7.40 & 8.10 -68yds)

runners.name: Berry Edge
runners.comment: Fair on the Flat (three wins) but beaten 30l+ on both hurdling starts this spring
runners.spotlight: Fair on the Flat (three wins) but beaten 30l+ on his two hurdling starts this spring (2m3f/2m) and needs to take a big step forward today.

runners.name: Soldier At Arms
runners.comment: Out of a half-sister to high-class jumper Yorkhill; probably best watched on debut
runners.spotlight: 52,000euros foal; second foal; dam once-raced sister to high-class jumper Yorkhill; makes belated debut in a run-of-the-mill event but probably best watched all the same.

stable_tour.quote: He's a brother to Willie Mullins' dual bumper winner Ballygunner Castle, but he's unraced as he got injured as a four-year-old and missed 18 months. He's back in work now and looks smart. 16-10-24

runners.name: Solent Gateway
runners.comment: Fair form when placed on last three of his four hurdling starts; strong claims today
runners.spotlight: Useful Flat racer who was placed on the last three of his four hurdling starts for Donald McCain last season, most recently when second in C&D (good) maiden last month; obvious contender.

quotes.quote: I knew Solent Gateway quite well because I've ridden against him a few times and I just did what I was told by the boss. I got an easy lead. I cantered round in front, he was a relaxed horse and he was very push-button - Hollie Doyle, rider.
Solent Gateway never relaxed but he needs to be held up really and you can't do it in a race like that. He'll learn - Hugo Palmer, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He had a handful of runs for me when I first arrived before we decided he might benefit from wind surgery. It certainly didn't do him any harm as he has added victories at Wolverhampton and Haydock to his CV. Last time out at Newbury he ran another fine race when fourth to Sweet William, who more than franked the form at Glorious Goodwood. Solent Gateway now heads to York next week and the flat, galloping 2m will be ideal for him. He's a tough and consistent individual who always runs his race. The flipside to that honesty is that he's not particularly well handicapped. 17-08-23

runners.name: Vanilla Dancer
runners.comment: Exposed after 11 hurdle runs but is consistent; ought to make her presence felt again
runners.spotlight: Exposed after 11 hurdling starts but scores pretty good marks for her consistency and is suited by this track; placed in low-grade C&D (good) handicap on latest outing and ought to make her presence felt again; tongue-tie added.

runners.name: Celestial Reign
runners.comment: Placed on the Flat in Ireland in 2014 and ran well here on both hurdling starts this year
runners.spotlight: Placed on the Flat in Ireland last year and was in process of running well when brought down at penultimate flight here (2m1f, good) on stable/hurdle debut in March; beaten only about 2l when fourth of five (just behind Solent Gateway) over C&D (good) last month; must be considered.

runners.name: Jet Approach
runners.comment: Ran well to a point on hurdling debut but is probably one for a bit further down the line
runners.spotlight: From a good jumping family and ran well to a point on last month's hurdling debut at Hexham (2m, good) but was beaten about 32l in the end and is probably one for a bit further down the line.

6:40.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to firm in places (GoingStick: 7.6) (Watering) (Rail Movements: 6.10 & 7.10 -79yds and 7.40 & 8.10 -68yds)

runners.name: Delpotro
runners.breeder: E A R L Elevage Des Loges

prev_owners.owner: Ecurie Herve Guerin & Ecurie Horse Avenir

runners.comment: Free-going front-runner who ended last season with two pretty good efforts (one over C&D)
runners.spotlight: Free-going front-runner who was a dual chase winner in France last spring; 0-6 in Britain but ended last season with two pretty good efforts, the first a C&D (good) third behind Fearless Action; can make a bold bid.

runners.name: Clean Getaway
runners.comment: Won four in a row here in the autumn; probably needed last month's reappearance run
runners.spotlight: Won four in a row here in the autumn (two chases, two hurdles) and might well have needed last month's reappearance run at Carlisle; current mark probably demands a career-best performance but he's suited by good ground, and the return to this track is an obvious plus.

stable_tour.quote: He's lively but is a great character. He didn't run as I anticipated in his bumper, but I'm confident he's considerably gifted and suspect we'll try to win a bumper before hurdling. 19-10-21

runners.name: Nonbinding
runners.comment: Pulled up all five stable starts, most recently in good-ground C&D chase
runners.spotlight: Dual hurdle winner for Gordon Elliott in 2022 but pulled up all five starts for current stable, most recently when 125-1 for good-ground C&D chase last month; swaps cheekpieces for refitted blinkers today.

quotes.race: Bar One Racing Bet In-Play Maiden Hurdle (Div II)
quotes.quote: We fancied Nonbinding in Downpatrick and he just got wiped out of it. Davy (Russell) was happy with him there today. He probably wants further and he's a big chaser. He jumped well today - Gordon Elliott, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: I fancied him big time for the Land Rover Bumper last season but he burst blood vessels. He's back going well and looks a lot stronger. We'll start him off in three or four weeks all being well. 15-11-21

runners.name: Fearless Action
runners.comment: Didn't really fire here last month but won in good style over C&D in March; a possible
runners.spotlight: Needs to bounced back from last month's below-par C&D run but he produced a good performance to win by 6l here in March (good ground) and is now only 4lb above that mark; a possible.

runners.name: Conquer The Breeze
runners.comment: Got his act together over fences at end of last season, latterly when second over C&D
runners.spotlight: Failed to complete his first four chases but, from a reduced mark, got his act together on final two starts last season; nudged up only 1lb for his clear second over C&D (good) last month and has obvious claims if in similar form again.

runners.name: Belle Na Bann

prev_owners.owner: Ms D Morley, S Dobson & Partner

runners.comment: Out of form over hurdles at end of last season; makes belated chasing debut today
runners.spotlight: 4-28 over hurdles; ended last season in poor form and has left it very late in the day to launch her chasing career; others look much safer.

runners.name: Jackhammer

prev_owners.owner: Dennis J Coppola & Mrs Dianne Sayer

runners.comment: Back from break with two low-key runs but can't be ruled out off such a lowly mark
runners.spotlight: Veteran who has done most of his winning on the Flat and is 0-11 over fences; returned from break with two low-key runs last month (hurdle/chase) and needs to up his game but can't be ruled out off such a lowly mark.

quotes.quote: Jackhammer has been running well for us over hurdles and at the start of the year we were struggling to find a rhythm and find races for him, but then he dropped into it at Perth and we had a nice couple of wins up there. He's been a great horse for us so we're delighted - Dianne Sayer, trainer.
Jackhammer was highly rated as a two-year-old so we knew he had the engine - it's just been a bit of a thinking process - Dianne Sayer, trainer.

quotes.race: Whitsbury Manor Stud EBF Stallions Blagrave Maiden Stakes (Plus 10 Race)
quotes.quote: That's not really a surprise, although we don't have many first-time-out 2yo winners. We didn't have our first runner until Windsor on Monday, and that one ran quite well, and Jackhammer was working best of ours, although we don't have a grass gallop so that was a question mark. He's a big horse and a May foal, so there's no rush. He's one for next year, but I think he's pretty useful - William Knight, trainer.

7:10.race_name: Fairlight Studio New Beginnings For Spring Mares' Handicap Hurdle
7:10.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to firm in places (GoingStick: 7.6) (Watering) (Rail Movements: 6.10 & 7.10 -79yds and 7.40 & 8.10 -68yds)

runners.name: Laravie
runners.comment: Form of C&D maiden second in February is ordinary but she remains lightly raced
runners.spotlight: Ex-Irish 6yo; weakened out of contention on handicap debut at Fakenham (2m4f, good; first-time cheekpieces) in January and form of subsequent C&D maiden second isn't anything to get too excited about but she remains lightly raced; returns from 97-day break today.

runners.name: Feach Amach
runners.comment: Transformed by wind op/cheekpieces last month, winning twice (once over C&D); big player
runners.spotlight: Transformed by combination of wind surgery and cheekpieces last month, winning over C&D (good) and at Perth (2m4f, good to soft); raised another 6lb since last time but commands respect in current mood.

quotes.race: bettingsites.ltd.uk @bettingsitesltd Juvenile Hurdle (Go North Grey Bomber Qualifier) (GBB)
quotes.quote: Feach Amach had a promising run at Fontwell in August but things didn't go the way we hoped last time. However, she was fit and well today and Lorcan gave her a fantastic ride. The other horse jinked but I think she still would have got there - Paul Willis, owner.

runners.name: Lone Star
runners.comment: Ran well for a long way at Kelso on Wednesday but remains without a win since March 2023
runners.spotlight: Regressive 8yo who has gone more than two years without a win; ran well for a long way in first-time cheekpieces (retained) at Kelso (2m5f, good) on Wednesday but needs to build on that performance here.

quotes.race: Racing TV Go North Lady Buttons Mares' Hurdle Series Final (A Handicap Hurdle) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: We've not overworked Lone Star because she's been a bit keen and she's getting better all the time. I don't know where the end of it is. I don't know how good she might be - Phil Kirby, trainer.

Lone Star was quite keen and gassy when we got her and we tried a few different ways of riding her. She's only just learnt to be a racehorse and see her races out - Joe Williamson, jockey, speaking on Sky Sports Racing.

runners.name: Park Hind
runners.comment: Won maiden point last month but struggled when back under rules a few days later
runners.spotlight: 0-18 under rules when trained in Ireland; won five-runner maiden point for new connections last month but was pulled up when 66-1 for Kelso handicap hurdle (2m5f, good) a few days later.

runners.name: Janworth

prev_owners.owner: Mr & Mrs Ward Jamie Snowden Racing Club

runners.comment: Off since poor run last June but has good claims if judged on earlier Fontwell second
runners.spotlight: Lightly raced 8yo; absent since disappointing performance 11 months ago but kept on well for second (no match for very progressive rival) when upped to 2m3f for handicap debut at Fontwell (good) two starts back and has a big role to play here if back on song after her layoff.

runners.name: Suitably Surprised
runners.comment: Dual hurdle winner in November; may have needed last month's reappearance run
runners.spotlight: Came good with two hurdle wins in November (2m1f here/1m7f), and was not discredited when second of four on subsequent chasing debut; well beaten over C&D last month, after a break, but may have needed that outing and remains unexposed over 2m4f.

stable_tour.quote: We bought her after she finished second in an Irish point-to-point at Lisronagh in March. She's showing the team at Sam England's all the right signs and will be out in the summer. She didn't stay 3m in points but should be competitive in bumpers and novice hurdles. Her dam is a daughter of Chomba Womba, who was a triple Grade 2 winner for Nicky Henderson and has produced plenty of winners already, so it's a good bloodline. There are shares available in her. 14-06-24

runners.name: Lillistar
runners.comment: No match for Feach Amach when second over C&D last month but is 19lb better off today
