runners.spotlight: No match for next-time-out winner Feach Amach when second over C&D (good) last month and now 0-6 over hurdles but that was still a pretty good effort and she's 19lb better off with that rival today.

7:40.race_name: Visit The New betvickers.com Website Handicap Hurdle
7:40.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to firm in places (GoingStick: 7.6) (Watering) (Rail Movements: 6.10 & 7.10 -79yds and 7.40 & 8.10 -68yds)

runners.name: Piecederesistance

prev_owners.owner: Michael Tabor & Derrick Smith & Mrs John Magnier

runners.comment: Useful on the Flat in his prime but absent since heavy defeat over hurdles in December
runners.spotlight: Useful on the Flat in his prime but has 0-7 strike-rate over hurdles and was tailed off in Market Rasen handicap on latest outing, in December; getting back on good ground will suit him but others in this line-up have much less to prove.

quotes.race: Pontefract And District Golf Club Ltd Handicap
quotes.quote: Piecederesistance is a horse whose taken a little bit of time to get to know. We've given him a bit of time and hopefully he's going to repay us. He was too buzzed up over hurdles, we gave him the winter off, we sent him to Cindy Burnett to do some flat work with and that's been the making of him. Billy (Garritty) said he'd be better in a better race when they go that bit quicker - Micky Hammond, trainer.

runners.name: Trailblazer
runners.comment: Made all over C&D last month and has since run well at Perth; likely contender
runners.spotlight: Sometimes races a bit too freely but he made all for wide-margin C&D (good) win last month and also ran well when second of 15 at Perth (2m, good to soft) soon afterwards; swaps blinkers for first-time visor today; likely contender.

runners.name: Mr Sundancer

prev_owners.owner: Miss Rachel O'Neill & John C Hurley

runners.comment: Ex-Irish 7yo; not at best on any of three runs for this stable towards end of 2024
runners.spotlight: Ex-Irish 7yo; won at Downpatrick (2m2f, good) last summer but below that form on all three starts for Mark Walford towards end of last year, albeit his fourth here (2m4f, good to soft) on Boxing Day was a better run than eventual 23l defeat might suggest.

runners.name: Addosh
runners.comment: Not beaten far on stable debut but twice well beaten on the Flat since
runners.spotlight: Not beaten far when sixth of nine on stable debut at Huntingdon (2m, good) in March but this regressive mare was soundly beaten on both subsequent Flat starts and her overall profile is not appealing.

runners.name: Gavin
runners.comment: Dominated from the front at Ffos Las a week ago; obvious contender under penalty
runners.spotlight: Back in good form since his winter break, more recently when dominating from the front to win unchallenged at Ffos Las (2m, good; heavily backed) a week ago; remains well handicapped under 7lb penalty and should be fine on this tighter track; good chance.

runners.name: Jet Patrol
runners.comment: 0-8 over hurdles but this is easier than his latest assignment; could have a say
runners.spotlight: 0-8 over hurdles and his tendency to race too freely remains a worry but he'll find this easier than the series final he contested at Musselburgh in March, and he caught the eye when making steady headway from the rear there two starts ago.

stable_tour.quote: He's been quite frustrating but we've just had his wind done. At Musselburgh the time before last, he looked like he was going to run a really nice race but then fell at the last. He went to Newcastle after that and looked like the winner two out before fading away to nothing. He could go for the Go North Sea Pigeon Final. 22-01-25

runners.name: Foshan
runners.comment: Twice ran okay last month (hurdles/Flat) but is 0-26 overall now; 6lb wrong today
runners.spotlight: Respectable fifth over C&D (good; first run after wind op) last month and didn't run badly on the Flat a fortnight later (first-time tongue-tie) but he's 0-26 under all codes now and is 6lb out of the weights today.

8:10.race_name: Resolve Contracts Open National Hunt Flat Race (Category 1 Elimination) (GBB Race)
8:10.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to firm in places (GoingStick: 7.6) (Watering) (Rail Movements: 6.10 & 7.10 -79yds and 7.40 & 8.10 -68yds)

runners.name: Dartmouth Castle
runners.comment: Shaped with significant promise when sixth of seven at Doncaster; this race looks easier
runners.spotlight: Out of a fairly useful Flat winner; shaped with significant promise and was beaten only about 6l when sixth of seven at Doncaster (good) two months ago; this race looks easier; likely contender.

runners.name: Scairp Dubh
runners.comment: Won good-ground point bumper by 5l on debut in March; makes rules debut today
runners.spotlight: Half-brother to useful hurdler Deepsand and fairly useful hurdler Our Thomas; won good-ground point bumper by 5l at Tranwell on debut in March and makes his rules debut in a modest race; interesting.

runners.name: Fleet Street Flyer
runners.comment: First foal from a fair 6f/7f Flat winner; stable 0-15 in bumpers in last five seasons
runners.spotlight: First foal from a fair 6f/7f Flat winner; stable 0-15 in bumpers during last five seasons (all unplaced); considered only if lively in the betting.

runners.name: Miz Klimt
runners.comment: Displayed minor promise on both outings last season and enters calculations
runners.spotlight: Ran well to a point on debut in March and was beaten only about 5l when fourth of six at Hereford (good) last month; her form isn't anything to get too excited about but she enters calculations here.

runners.name: Shes A Dinger
runners.comment: Â£1,000 3yo; fifth foal; dam unraced; stable enjoys some success in bumpers
runners.spotlight: Â£1,000 3yo; fifth foal; dam unraced, out of 2m hurdle/2m4f chase winner; her pedigree does not quicken the pulse but she represents a stable that enjoys some bumper success.

3:42.race_name: Download The Raceday Ready App Handicap
3:42.going_detailed: GOOD TO FIRM (Good in places; 7.3; watered)

runners.name: Cosmos Raj
runners.comment: 4lb penalty for winning at Hamilton nine days ago; still feasibly treated; should go well
runners.spotlight: Took his record on turf to 7-34 when successful at Hamilton (8.3f, good to firm) nine days ago; 4lb penalty puts him on the same mark as when winning on the AW early last year; should go well despite his wide draw.

runners.name: Speeding Bullet
runners.owner: Slaters Arms Racing And Ged Shields
runners.comment: Well held on last month's stable debut after six months off; yet to convince over this far
runners.spotlight: Hasn't lived up to his name since making a successful nursery debut for Richard Hannon at Newmarket (7f, soft) in October 2023; well held on last month's stable debut after six months off and is still to convince over this far.

runners.name: Bobacious
runners.owner: The Trip To Syndicate And Partners
runners.comment: Most consistent but may face competition for the lead and something to prove back in trip
runners.spotlight: Front-runner who has proved most consistent since last summer, which included wins at Brighton and Windsor (1m2f, good to firm); may face competition for the lead, though, and something to prove back in trip.

stable_tour.quote: We bought him at the sales in November for a syndicate who wanted a horse to have fun with. He tends to be over-exuberant in his races and we put a hood on him first time out. I'd love to be telling you that he's relaxed, but he jumps the stalls so fast that he's very much there to be got at if he doesn't quite finish his race. He should be fun for the syndicate and hopefully he'll be winning at his level. His second last time at Nottingham was quite a good run - the winner was well handicapped - and he went back there on Tuesday and ran well again. 30-04-25

runners.name: Evelyns Phoenix
runners.comment: Has fitness to prove after eight months off; Alfie Boy looks the stable's main hope
runners.spotlight: Handy sort who won three times over 7f-1m2f last year, but has fitness to prove after eight months off; Alfie Boy looks the stable's main hope.

runners.name: Park Street
runners.comment: Won twice here in 2023; no surprise if he fares better back at this track
runners.spotlight: Won twice here in 2023, the latest over this trip from 3lb higher; hung badly right on his Thirsk return ten days ago but no surprise if he fares better back at this track.

quotes.quote: Tina (Jackson, trainer) has done well with Park Street because he's not easy. They've gone a good, even gallop which has suited me and he finished off well - Graham Lee, jockey.

runners.name: Alfie Boy
runners.comment: Bids for a hat-trick; back up 3lb; hard to dismiss in his current mood
runners.spotlight: Bids for hat-trick after recent wins over C&D (good) and at Ayr (1m, good to firm); back up 3lb; made all for both victories and may face competition for the lead here but still hard to dismiss in his current mood.

runners.name: Casilli
runners.owner: W H & Mrs J A Tinning & Mrs C Wallis
runners.comment: Five-time course winner; on a dangerous mark and could benefit from a contested lead
runners.spotlight: Five of her six wins have come here including three over this trip; losing run is up to 14 but she has dropped to a dangerous mark and could benefit if there is a contested lead up front.

runners.name: Northbound
runners.comment: 1-21 on turf, but only just beaten at Wetherby last time; each-way claims on stable debut
runners.spotlight: Two wins at around 1m on the AW this year; just 1-21 on turf but only beaten a short head back on grass at Wetherby (7f, good to firm) 16 days ago; 2lb higher on stable debut (same owner); each-way claims.

runners.name: Tees George
runners.comment: Went up in the weights for his easy C&D win last September; others preferred
runners.spotlight: Won easily in first-time cheekpieces over C&D (good) last September but went up 8lb as a result and has been well held in both outings since, albeit he may have needed his Thirsk return three weeks ago; others preferred.

stable_tour.quote: A lovely, big horse who hasn't run a bad race all year. He's no superstar but at his level he's very consistent. The only issue I have with him is he's a massive horse who's vlight-framed and it's hard to keep condition on him. His last two runs have been very good and he'll be winning sooner rather than later. 26-07-24

runners.name: Coolree
runners.comment: 4lb lower than when winning this race last year and ran well last time; interesting
runners.spotlight: Has a wide draw but that was also the case when he won this race for Amy Murphy last year (good); 4lb lower this time around and wasn't beaten far into fourth of eight at Thirsk (1m, good) three weeks ago; interesting.

runners.name: Dr Rio

prev_owners.owner: Just Wow Ltd, Mrs Melissa O'Neill & Robert Toogood

runners.comment: Last four wins have come here; back off last winning mark, but may need a stiffer test
runners.spotlight: Last four wins have come at this track and is back off the same mark as when successful here (1m2f, good) last September; may need a stiffer test than this now, though.

runners.name: Makalu
runners.comment: C&D winner; made a winning return on the AW in March, but well beaten back on turf since
runners.spotlight: Four wins last year included one over C&D; made a winning return at Southwell (1m, AW) in March but well beaten back on turf twice since; not quite sure what to expect.

quotes.quote: Makalu has turned around this year and he seems to be enjoying his racing now. I think he likes dropping in and staying on from the back and it gives him confidence. He's very gutsy when he does get there, he puts his head down and tries - James Sullivan, jockey, speaking to Racing TV.

quotes.race: British Stallion Studs EBF Restricted Novice Stakes (For Horses In Bands C & D) (GBB Race) (Div II)
quotes.quote: Makalu has been a work in progress, I'd imagine he wants seven furlongs really - Kevin Ryan, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He had a great 2024, winning four times, and returned from a long winter break to score on his reappearance last month over a mile at Southwell. He's usually dropped out the back by Jack Sullivan, who knows exactly how to ride him. I'm lining him up for a race at Thirsk's evening fixture on April 22. 09-04-25

runners.name: Dandys Angel
runners.comment: Five-time winner over 1m2f here, but last three performances leave plenty to be desired
runners.spotlight: Five-time winner over 1m2f here and completed a hat-trick over 1m2f-1m4f elsewhere last autumn; last three performances leave plenty to be desired, though, and she needs further than this in any case; drawn widest.

3:12.going_detailed: GOOD TO FIRM (Good in places; 7.3; watered)

runners.name: Keldeo
runners.owner: Ownaracehorse, O Pears And T&T Racing
runners.comment: Won at Pontefract last month; close fourth over C&D last week; likely player
runners.spotlight: Record is 4-18, the most recent success at Pontefract (5f) last month; close fourth off this mark in higher grade over C&D (good to firm) eight days ago, showing that she's still in form; drawn widest but otherwise holds strong claims.

quotes.race: EBF Restricted Novice Stakes (Band D) (EBF Restricted Race Qualifier) (GBB/IRE Incentive Race)
quotes.quote: Keldeo has come forward from her debut. She ran a nice race at Catterick but just got tired late. She has a lot of scope and should make a cracking three-year-old too and I'm very hopeful for her future prospects - Ollie Pears, trainer.

runners.name: Ingleby Archie
runners.comment: Inconsistent since 5f double last summer but is capable of being involved
runners.spotlight: Completed a 5f double last summer (maiden previously); inconsistent results since but is capable of being involved; runner-up off this mark at Thirsk (6f) on penultimate start.

quotes.quote: Ingleby Archie was getting warm in the saddling boxes and while it was humid in there I admitted to the owner it was a bit of a worry. On last year's form he looks quite well handicapped but it took a couple of runs to get going - Adrain Nicholls, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He won last time out at Redcar - it took me long enough to do it. He's a grand horse who finished second three times in a row. He got beat at 1-8 at Southwell on his comeback in February, but I don't have them tuned up in the winter so much. Hopefully he can come forward from his win as his form last year, when he kept knocking into one, was good. 26-07-24

runners.name: Fierce
runners.comment: Two encouraging efforts for new stable, making the frame over C&D latest
runners.spotlight: Dual sprint winner (AW/turf) for previous yard; couple of encouraging efforts this season for new stable, keeping-on fourth in higher grade over C&D (good) latest; enters the reckoning.

runners.name: Ganesha
runners.comment: Regained the winning thread in March; below form in two runs since
runners.spotlight: Belatedly regained the winning thread in March (5f, AW); has failed to repeat that form in two subsequent starts, looking less than straightforward returned to turf latest; others preferred.

runners.name: Miss Brazen
runners.breeder: Exors Of The Late Mr A A Byrne
runners.owner: W H & Mrs J A Tinning & Mrs C Wallis

prev_owners.owner: D & R Chapman, W&j Tinning & C Wallis

runners.comment: On a two-year losing spell but is well handicapped and suited by Beverley
runners.spotlight: Losing spell goes back to her C&D success (off 7lb higher) two years ago, but she's attractively handicapped and has possibilities returned to this venue on seasonal debut; close third in most recent Beverley attempt; tongue-tie applied.

runners.name: Maris Angel
runners.comment: Two attempts on turf have resulted in a success and close second; interesting
runners.spotlight: Stagnated on AW in autumn/winter and now returns from four-month break; two attempts on turf have resulted in a success and close second, both over 5f at Redcar; still unexposed in this sphere and looks interesting off a workable mark.

runners.name: Midnight Lir
runners.comment: Good chance off current mark on best form, which includes a C&D win
runners.spotlight: Never landed a blow at Pontefract (race won by Keldeo) on reappearance, extending a losing run that goes back to 2023; certainly holds a good chance off current mark on best form, which includes a C&D win.

runners.name: Crafty Spirit
runners.owner: Con Harrington And Caballo Racing Two
runners.comment: Drops to new trip on debut for new stable; market may prove best guide
runners.spotlight: Record of 1-11 for Clive Cox, the win over 6f on AW; sold for 16,000gns since last run but owner retains a share; given that he lacks recent match practice and drops to new trip, the market may prove best guide.

runners.name: Opal Storm
runners.comment: Close second at Doncaster last time; consistent over C&D last term; solid
runners.spotlight: Gradually back to form this season, close second at Doncaster (5f) most recently; built up a consistent record (44214) in C&D events last term, the success in August; receives weight all round and has solid claims.

quotes.race: Rob Burrow Dare To Dream Handicap
quotes.quote: Opal Storm likes the place but she just needs a bit of luck in running - Brian Rothwell, trainer.

4:42.race_name: Racing Again On Saturday 24 May Handicap

runners.name: Arie Gordye
runners.comment: Showed some promise at Beverley on handicap/seasonal debut; possibilities

runners.name: Rommie The Miracle

runners.spotlight: Form figures of 042 reflect her steady progress, runner-up to easy winner at Ripon (1m2f) most recently; interesting handicap debutante, with another step forward plausible.

runners.name: Maundy Thursday

runners.spotlight: Out of a 1m4f winner; four-race maiden who has shown bits of promise, including in Windsor handicap (11.5f) most recently; may build on that effort; similar type to Arie Gordye.

runners.name: Analogical

runners.spotlight: Prescott runner who made no impact in 7f events last autumn; like so many from his yard, he looks the type to improve markedly now handicapping and upped in distance; respected, especially if strong in the betting.

runners.name: Captious Cantor
runners.comment: Shaped much better than bare result in latest AW run; looks open to improvement
runners.spotlight: All four outings on AW; shaped much better than the bare result in Wolverhampton handicap (9.5f) latest, keeping on when badly hampered (eased thereafter); looks open to improvement.

runners.name: Belle Amie
runners.comment: Related to winners for her yard and could well improve now handicapping; interesting
runners.spotlight: Related to several winners for her yard; hasn't lived up to that pedigree in AW novice events (finished last each time) but could well improve significantly now switched to handicap level; has an attractive opening mark judged on breeding; market support would heighten interest.

runners.name: Gungnir
runners.comment: Ran well in first-time blinkers when last seen; now goes in cheekpieces
runners.spotlight: Absent since showing some improvement in first-time blinkers at Redcar (third over 1m; handicap debut) in September; now goes in cheekpieces; could go well again, provided he stays the longer distance.

runners.name: Call Me Audrey

runners.spotlight: Six-race maiden; posted an improved effort, neck second, at Wolverhampton (upped to 1m4f, AW) most recently; may remain competitive, provided that form is backed up.

runners.name: Max The Tiger
runners.comment: Still hasn't managed to beat a rival and has the worst chance on bare form
runners.spotlight: Five-race maiden who still hasn't managed to beat a rival; accordingly, has the worst chance on bare figures.

runners.name: Zappata

runners.name: Kimeko Glory
runners.comment: Returns to the scene of her comfortable reappearance win; in the mix
runners.spotlight: Opened her account with a comfortable win over C&D (good) on turf/seasonal debut; below that form at Redcar since but wasn't entirely disgraced and may do better still in this sphere; enters calculations back at the scene of her strongest display.

runners.name: Cangofar
runners.breeder: Sarl De Chambure Haras D'Etreham Et Al
runners.comment: Four-race maiden who is bred to do better still
runners.spotlight: Four-race maiden who is bred to do better still, being a brother to a winner for his connections; may be capable of improvement with Redcar reappearance under his belt; market support should be heeded.

runners.name: Arundel
runners.comment: Related to winners for his connections; interesting handicap debutant
runners.spotlight: Best AW result when third at Southwell (1m) on penultimate outing; related to winners for his connections and looks open to improvement now handicapping; interesting contender.

stable_tour.quote: He's named after where my father trained and we quite like him. He's a big, backward horse who's had only three runs and was third in a maiden. He'll now go handicapping and we'll see how we get on. 30-04-25

runners.name: Elizabeths Legacy
runners.owner: J Munroe, D Walshe & M Mchale

prev_owners.owner: M McHale, J Munroe, D Walshe

runners.comment: Best watched on reappearance unless the market speaks favourably

runners.name: West Kirby

runners.spotlight: Modest form at best as a 2yo for previous yard and ran dismally (last of 12) over 1m on reappearance; combination of new trip and first-time cheekpieces needs to have major effect.

runners.spotlight: Has weak form claims, exacerbated by a heavy defeat in the C&D event won by Kimeko Glory most recently; needs a big step forward in this second handicap attempt.

runners.name: Cuda Been A Rowlex

runners.spotlight: Opened his account in Redcar contest (1m2f) but failed to back up that form and didn't seem beaten entirely by the drop back to 1m at Wetherby later in April; not sure what to expect.

runners.name: U S Grant
runners.comment: Showed improvement last time and may build on that effort
runners.spotlight: Six-race maiden who showed improvement with third-place finish in small field at Newcastle (12.5f, AW) most recently, shaping as if this return to shorter will suit; possibilities.

2:12.race_name: Hurn 'Confined' EBF Novice Stakes (For Horses Who Have Had No More Than One Run) (GBB Race)
2:12.going_detailed: GOOD TO FIRM (Good in places; 7.3; watered)

runners.name: Blue To Blue
runners.comment: Beat four rivals at Southwell despite showing signs of greenness; open to progress
runners.spotlight: Blue Point colt who beat four rivals at Southwell (AW) despite showing signs of greenness by jumping a shadow and hanging left; stiffer task under a penalty in this field but is open to progress.

quotes.race: Play At The Races Stableduel EBF Novice Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I'm delighted with that. Blue To Blue isn't a horse who shows loads at home. He's a nice horse and he was ready to run but he saves a bit for himself, the way he jumped a shadow in the first furlong and he ran on well once he got a smack behind the saddle, it's the first time he's ever had that. He can only improve for the run. I said to the owner before the race he'll be better over six furlongs - Karl Burke, trainer.

runners.name: Ameeq
runners.comment: Â£50,000 yearling; by Mehmas; withdrawn (upset in stalls) at Thirsk last month
runners.spotlight: Â£50,000 yearling; by Mehmas and sibling to three winners, notably Tell William (1m/8.5f; 83); dam 1m AW winner; withdrawn (upset in stalls) at Thirsk last month; has the worst of the draw.

runners.name: Captain Bruce
runners.comment: Â£24,000 yearling; Awtaad half-brother to a 7f/8.5f winner; market helpful
runners.spotlight: Â£24,000 yearling; Awtaad half-brother to 7f/8.5f winner Stayincotai (including US turf; RPR 98); unraced dam's siblings include Listed-placed 7f 2yo scorer Private Alexander; market helpful.

runners.name: Head For Freedom
runners.comment: 14,000gns foal; brother to a sprint winner; one of two newcomers for this yard
runners.spotlight: 14,000gns foal; brother to 5f-6f winner Prop Forward (including AW; RPR 108), out of 5f/6f winner (including 2yo/Listed; 106); one of two newcomers for this yard; check the betting.

runners.spotlight: 72,000euros foal, 180,000gns yearling; Lucky Vega half-brother to five winners, notably Once More For Luck (6f including 2yo; RPR 103); dam maiden half-sister to Middle Park winner; wears tongue-tie; interesting debutant.

runners.name: Society Of Honor
runners.comment: Strong-finishing third at Ayr; stable has landed this race for last three years
runners.spotlight: Started favourite in small field at Ayr (good) where he took a long time to find his stride but eventually finished strongly and hit the line a clear third, beaten only 1l; stable has landed this race for last three years; respected with progress on the cards.

runners.name: Spartacus Warrior
runners.comment: Brings the worst form having finished down the field at Thirsk
runners.spotlight: Brings the worst form having finished down the field in Thirsk contest, recording a modest RPR; needs a big step forward.

runners.name: Artista

runners.spotlight: Promising third of 12, beaten just 2l, in C&D event (good) last month despite being forced to race wide from the highest draw; hasn't fared much better on that front but otherwise looks one of the main players.

runners.name: Dabbling

runners.spotlight: 2,000gns yearling; by Ghaiyyath and first foal of unraced half-sister to winners Leyhaimur (6f 2yo) and Impressive Act (6f) and daughter of 7f Group 3 scorer; connections had a 2yo debut winner (SP 15-2) last month.

runners.name: Edens Choice

runners.spotlight: Magna Grecia half-sister to three winners, notably Flash Gordon (6f; RPR 102); dam 7f 2yo scorer (78), half-sister to Cheveley Park winner Seazun; yard also runs Head For Freedom; market instructive.

runners.name: Homestrait
runners.comment: Belied her 80-1 odds with second-place finish over C&D last week; possibilities
runners.spotlight: Belied her 80-1 odds with second of 12 in C&D maiden (good to firm) eight days ago, proving no match for the winner but faring best of the newcomers; clear possibilities, provided that apparent promise is confirmed.

runners.name: Diamond Dude

runners.spotlight: Registered maiden win last May; inconsistent since but ran respectably in C&D handicap most recently (second start for new yard); leading form contender in first-time headgear.

runners.name: Rosezan

runners.spotlight: Ninth foal; half-brother to four winners including two French-trained Listed scorers; dam Listed-placed 1m winner.

runners.spotlight: Slowly away and never contention on debut at Gowran last week; can be ruled out.

runners.spotlight: Fourth foal; brother to Group-placed 1m4f winner Comic Book; dam French 6f winner, half-sister to 2yo Group 3 winners Kalahara (5f) and Sasparella (6f), out of half-sister to 1m/1m2f Grade 1 winner Mondialiste.

runners.name: Washington Street

runners.spotlight: Unplaced in two 7f outings at two; has been gelded; extra furlong may produce improvement.

runners.name: Faiyum

quotes.race: Aesop's Fables At Compas Stallions Irish EBF Fillies Maiden
quotes.quote: We knew Faiyum was nice but she's green as grass so there should be buckets of improvement in her. Her sister handled that ground so we didn't think it'd be a problem. The Park Express closed the other day and I put her in because I said it'd look silly if we didn't as we like her. No more than you'd expect for a Juddmonte filly so fingers crossed she can continue to progress - Ger Lyons, trainer.
