runners.name: Red Hugh Odonnell
runners.comment: 0-7; likely to pick up a handicap at some point but very opposable back in a maiden
runners.spotlight: Competing off 70 when close up in a 7f Leopardstown handicap last month (first time in this headgear combination) but failed to build on that last week at the Curragh; very opposable back in a maiden.

runners.name: Queen Of Thunder
runners.comment: Highly respectable 6l seventh of 13 in last year's Irish 1,000 Guineas; absent since
runners.spotlight: Placed in two 7f maidens as a 2yo and was a highly respectable 6l seventh of 13 in last year's Irish 1,000 Guineas (good to yielding); absent since then but she sets the standard by some margin back in a maiden and she has Group-race entries.

runners.name: Royal Entry
runners.comment: Useful form for Jim Bolger but 0-6 and she's rated 18lb inferior to the Condon filly
runners.spotlight: Holds the Group 1 Pretty Polly entry, as does Queen Of Thunder; close up in two big-field Curragh maidens last season (1m2f/1m4f) but was beaten six times for Jim Bolger and she's rated 18lb inferior to the Condon filly; new trainer fits a visor.

runners.name: Mogwli
runners.comment: Has gone up 7lb for Gowran win and may struggle to uphold form with fourth-placed Jurality
runners.spotlight: Lost form after Bellewstown win last October; took advantage of his reduced mark at Gowran last week. giving this rider her first success; has gone up 7lb and may struggle to uphold form with fourth-placed Jurality; winner of seven of her 83 starts, including back-to-back successes in 2020.

quotes.quote: Mogwli took me there once I was able to take my time on him. Once I got past the horse in front he was able to pick up - Wesley Joyce, rider
Mogwli broke well, there is lovely fresh ground on that rail and Jack just kept him happy. The horse fought them off well too - Willie McCreery, trainer.
Mogwli doesn't like the wind and having it behind him was the best thing for him. He rode a grand race and I loved the way he fought back at the finish - Willie McCreery, trainer.
Mogwli was bred by my wife. He's a tough and hardy little fellow and he loves racing. He'll be kept on the go for the apprentices to ride - Willie McCreery, trainer

runners.name: Relevant Range
runners.comment: Ran well at Bellewstown on return, testing conditions probably against him at Limerick
runners.spotlight: Shock 50-1 winner at Listowel last September; made a bright start to the season at Bellewstown; testing conditions probably against him at Limerick.

quotes.quote: Relevant Range was flat out the whole way but Darragh got him travelling and enthusiastic. It was a fantastic ride because the hors isn't the most genuine - Gillian Scott, trainer.

runners.name: Arthur Rose
runners.comment: 1m4f stretched her stamina last time; previous 1m run at Cork was a lot better.
runners.spotlight: Yet to finish in the first three; 1m4f stretched her stamina last time; previous 1m run at Cork was a lot better.

runners.name: Haeret In Pectore
runners.comment: Won in Poland, can probably improve from Curragh run but appears held by  Saxon Kingdom
runners.spotlight: Won over 7f in Poland last year; 33-1 when towards the back over 7f at the Curragh on Irish debut; can probably improve but appears held by Saxon Kingdom.

runners.name: Saith Seren
runners.comment: Career-best when second over C&D last October but that was on heavy ground
runners.spotlight: Failed to stay 1m4f at Galway on final start last season; career-best when second over C&D last October but that was on heavy ground.

runners.name: Still She Blooms
runners.comment: Consistent form at Dundalk before a creditable fourth at Gowran, possibly best at 7f
runners.spotlight: Consistent form over 7f at Dundalk before a creditable fourth at Gowran; Colin Keane aboard for her last two runs now rides Dazzing Spirit; good apprentice takes over; possibly best at 7f.

runners.name: Harry The Rogue
runners.comment: Sixth behind Mogwli at Gowran, may struggle to turn the tables on fourth-placed Jurality
runners.spotlight: Narrowly got off the mark at Naas on his 20th start; finished sixth behind Mogwli at Gowran last week and may struggle to turn the tables on fourth-placed Jurality.

runners.name: Jurality

prev_owners.owner: Straight To Victory Syndicate/Geoffrey Thorpe/Brian Bunyan
Straight To Victory Syndicate, Geoffrey Thorpe & Brian Bunya

runners.comment: Has come down in the ratings, worth considering following last week's fourth to Mogwli
runners.spotlight: Has come down in the ratings and seems to have found his level; worth considering following last week's fourth to Mogwli over this trip at Gowran; winner has gone up 7lb.

runners.name: Say Youre Sorry
runners.comment: Fourth in two 1m handicaps at Dundalk last summer, poor run over further on AW last time
runners.spotlight: Seemed to be improving when fourth in two 1m handicaps at Dundalk last summer; failed to stay the extended 1m2f at the same venue two months ago.

runners.name: Cu Chulainn
runners.comment: Both wins came on AW, losing run stretches back nearly three years, up against it
runners.spotlight: Both wins came on AW; losing run stretches back nearly three years; struggled in six runs last year; tailed off on seasonal debut at Limerick; up against it.

runners.name: Saxon Kingdom
runners.comment: Good second at Dundalk, ran creditably from out of the handicap at the Curragh last time
runners.spotlight: Longstanding maiden; Dundalk second early last month was promising; respectably run from 6lb out of the handicap when eighth in a 25-runner handicap at the Curragh last week; each-way chance in a race of this lesser standard.

runners.name: Dazzling Spirit
runners.comment: Showed her best form for Tom Mullins in 2022, promising start for this stable last month
runners.spotlight: Four-time winner; showed her best form for Tom Mullins in 2022, when one of her three wins came at this venue; out of sorts last season; made a promising start for this stable when third over a slightly longer trip at Gowran early last month; good prospects now with Colin Keane booked.

quotes.quote: Dazzling Spirit won here last year and I hoped coming back here would work. She ran away with him down the hill but Jamie gets on well with her, that's his fourth win on her - Tom Mullins, trainer.

During the summer jockeys were saying Dazzling Spirit needed a little bit further but she just wouldn't let herself down on the ground. On the soft she's letting herself down and she's getting quicker, that's why I took a chance coming back to seven. At home she's very speedy and her half-sister Powersville was a five or six-furlong mare. She'll go to Galway now for a seven-furlong handicap and that might see her out for the season - Tom Mullins, trainer.

Dazzling Spirit got a lovely run up the rail. She travelled well and hit the line well, she was still a bit green and ran around a bit. She was a bit unlucky last time but she enjoyed herself today - Jamie Powell, rider.

runners.name: Eagles Whistle
runners.comment: Weak form in handicaps, never in the hunt at Gowran last week, hard to make a case for her
runners.spotlight: Weak form in handicaps; never in the hunt at Gowran last week; hard to make a case for her.

runners.name: Deuteronomy
runners.comment: Has had plenty of chances, one of his better runs at Leopardstown on his penultimate start
runners.spotlight: 26-race maiden. out of form on the AW during the winter; best run for a long time when third of 10 at Leopardstown (7f, good)  beaten only 2l after being badly hampered late on; not as effective on heavy ground at Gowran; could go well.

runners.name: Second Fiddle
runners.comment: Has failed to reach the first four in 12 starts, fair run behind Harry The Rogue on latest
runners.spotlight: Low-rated mare; has failed to reach the first four in 12 starts; fair run when seventh of 20 behind Harry The Rogue at Naas on seasonal debut; not a lost cause on that evidence.

runners.name: Glinka
runners.comment: Behind Ice Jet at Navan and fared no better at Cork; headgear removed
runners.spotlight: Never a threat when behind Ice Jet at Navan (1m2f, good) on his penultimate run and fared no better at Cork (1m4f, soft) when tried in cheekpieces; those aids are now removed, as is the tongue-tie sported on his last four starts; bit to prove now.

runners.name: Ice Jet
runners.comment: Third on handicap debut at Navan (1m2f) in what looked a decent race for the grade
runners.spotlight: Gelded ahead of handicap debut at Navan (1m2f, good) and finished well for third in what looked a decent race for the grade; more to come over this far.

runners.name: Refreshment
runners.comment: Shown enough to believe he can win soon but 1m3f isn't an obvious positive on his pedigree
runners.spotlight: Six defeats include three handicaps but he's run well this season over 1m at Bellewstown (good) and Gowran (heavy); however, only 1lb lower this time and 1m3f isn't an obvious positive on his pedigree.

runners.name: Eagles Dream
runners.comment: Opposable on handicap form; up in trip and pedigree is a mix of speed and stamina
runners.spotlight: Held by Refreshment on their Gowran clash and again finished down the field at Cork (1m, good); raised in distance here and pedigree is a mix of speed and stamina.

runners.name: Sottsands
runners.comment: Was some way off Ice Jet on handicap debut at Navan but ran a bit better at Dundalk (1m2f)
runners.spotlight: Was some way off Ice Jet on handicap debut at Navan but ran a bit better at Dundalk (1m2f), though was only fifth of seven and had no excuses; others preferred.

runners.name: Vervain
runners.owner: T Egan & Crampscastle Bloodstock Ltd & J C Fleming
runners.comment: Was always going to be one for handicaps and any support should be noted
runners.spotlight: No more than minor promise in maidens from 7f to 1m2f; was always going to be one for handicaps and any support should be noted.

runners.name: Ranting And Raven
runners.comment: Only 4-1 for AW handicap debut and wasn't seen to best effect from off the pace
runners.spotlight: Minor maiden promise; only sixth of seven on handicap debut at Dundalk (1m2f) but did go off at only 4-1 and wasn't seen to best effect from off the pace (finished one position behind Sottsands); remains of interest and blinkers are now tried.

runners.name: Love Sonnet
runners.comment: Initial AW efforts weren't devoid of promise but took a backward step at Cork (1m, soft)
runners.spotlight: Initial AW efforts weren't devoid of promise but took a backward step at Cork (1m, soft); still commands respect with Keane booked for handicap debut.

runners.name: Jabbar
runners.comment: Below his best since beating Jerandme handsomely at Dundalk in January, 2-2 at this venue
runners.spotlight: Below his best in two further AW runs since beating Jerandme handsomely at Dundalk in January; 4-13 on turf and has to be respected on account of 2-2 record at this venue.

quotes.quote: Jabbar won well. I wondered with the weather would he be fit enough but he clearly was. We won't go back over hurdles until April maybe but we'll stay on the AW until then - Ger O'Leary, trainer.

runners.name: Busselton
runners.comment: Won the La Touche at Punchestown 12 days ago, 2m Flat winner at Galway last August
runners.spotlight: 2022 Kerry National winner; won a staying handicap on the Flat at Galway last July; won the La Touche at Punchestown 12 days ago; sufficiently versatile to merit consideration.

quotes.race: Mongey Communications La Touche Cup Cross Country Chase
quotes.quote: The La Touche is a special race and we're delighted to win it. It was our first runner in it and even just to have a horse for the banks is special. JJ [Slevin] gave Busselton a fantastic ride. I think the top of the ground is the key to him. He has won under all codes and will win again under most hopefully, but today is really the special day - Joseph O'Brien, trainer.

quotes.race: Guinness Kerry National Handicap Chase (Grade A)
quotes.quote: Busselton is as hard as nails. He jumps, stays, seems to go on any ground and he would have kept battling. It looked like a great performance. He has been on the go for over a year but he's a very honest horse - Brendan Powell, assistant trainer.

quotes.race: William Hill Ireland Home Of The Acca Rated Novice Chase
quotes.quote: Busselton is as tough as nails. He was flat out the whole way and he was very genuine, he has picked up and galloped home. He's just not very quick - Brendan Powell, assistant trainer.

Busselton is a great, likeable horse. He was having a bit of a look around in front but it was a good performance and he jumped well in the main barring being slow at one. Taking a lead would have been a help but I wanted a good, honest test for him because he's a stayer. He might be okay over a strongly-run 2m2f as well. The 10lb allowance as a 4yo is a big help and we're delighted to get another win out of him - JJ Slevin, rider

stable_tour.quote: He returned from six months off when fourth in the Lismullen Hurdle last weekend and I was very happy with the run. He came out of it in good shape. We will look at something like the Paddy Power Chase at Leopardstown for him now and he'll go down that staying handicap chase route. 27-11-23

He's a grand campaigner who has six wins to his name including the Kerry National at Listowel in the autumn. He ran in the Irish National earlier this week where the ground went against him and he was subsequently pulled up. He is better on spring ground and anything too heavy doesn't see him at his best. He's not one to give up on when granted better ground. 12-04-23

runners.name: Mo Ghille Mar
runners.comment: Middle-distance course winner, closely matched with The Banger Doyle and Robbies Rock
runners.spotlight: Middle-distance course winner last season; closely matched with The Banger Doyle and Robbies Rock on running over 1m4f at Navan, that pair have superior staying credentials.

runners.name: Mon Coeur
runners.owner: Karl Davis & T Egan & Mrs Bridget Dillon & Seamus Domegan

prev_owners.owner: D Glennane/T Egan/S O'Brien/Mrs B Dillon

runners.comment: Fit from hurdling, first run on the Flat since fifth in the 2023 Naas November Handicap.
runners.spotlight: Fit from hurdling; first run on the Flat since fifth of 16 in the 2023 Naas November Handicap; others preferred.

runners.name: Reverend Hubert
runners.comment: Useful hurdler/chaser, 3-17 on Flat, respectable eighth of 24 in last season's Cesarewitch
runners.spotlight: Promising novice hurdler in 2023 and won two novice chases last May/June; 3-17 on Flat; respectable eighth of 24 in last season's Cesarewitch.

quotes.quote: Reverend Hubert had the Flat speed after it turned into a bit of a sprint. Overall he is a very good jumper despite a couple of mistakes today - Charles Byrnes, trainer.

Reverend Hubert had schooled very well, and the distance and the ground were a big thing for him. He is a fine horse and will keep going for the summer. We'll look to Galway - Charles Byrnes, trainer.

Reverend Hubert loves jumping, it is the secret to him. The hurdles set him alight and he loves good ground. He will stay three miles and he could go back to the Flat next year - Charles Byrnes, trainer.

runners.name: Crassus
runners.comment: 3-22 on Flat and placed nine times, stays well but has been off for a long time
runners.spotlight: 3-22 on Flat and placed nine times; stays well but has been off for a long time and faces tough opposition here.

runners.name: Goin
runners.comment: Two 1m4f wins in Germany and Listed-placed over 2m, interesting recruit for Tony Martin
runners.spotlight: Two 1m4f wins in Germany and Listed-placed over 2m; interesting recruit for Tony Martin but probably best watched here.

runners.name: Jerandme
runners.comment: Veteran has shown he retains ability in a four-race spell at Dundalk after a long absence
runners.spotlight: Veteran who has been a notably versatile type; has shown he retains ability in a four-race spell at Dundalk after a long absence.

quotes.quote: Sean Flanagan said Jerandme had settled down an awful lot and basically Sean has been the making of him. He did exactly what Sean said. He settled, he jumped well and he actually won with a bit of speed today - Denis O'Regan, rider

quotes.race: Paddy Power HorseyMcHorseRace Ulster Cesarewitch Handicap
quotes.quote: Jerandme is a very geniuine horse and he never lets us down, no matter what we run him in. He stays very well and maybe next year he could be a contender for the Ascot Stakes. The extra trip today was a help. The Irish Cesarewitch could be the next stop - Noel Meade, trainer.

quotes.race: Follow Us On Facebook Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: He's a nice summer horse and bounces off that ground. He's a bit bubbly and the small field helped him here. It's a lovely track to be able to ride him like that, getting him relaxed. Sean [Flanagan] gave him a beautiful ride and got him into contention without having to buzz him up. At Cork last year he just threw his head in the air and flicked hurdles out of it, didn't lift a leg. I was worried that might happen again when he came to the track but hopefully he comes home sound and can run in novice hurdles through the summer. The reason we gave him time off was because he spent the whole of last season in training and ran into the summer, we felt he wouldn't go on heavy and then waited until now - Noel Meade, trainer of Jerandme
I'd say he's a nice horse. He pulled hard and was green but he's not slow - Mark O'Hare, rider

runners.name: Lord Erskine

prev_owners.owner: Exors of the Late Jeremiah Nolan

runners.comment: Admirable veteran won a valuable handicap hurdle at Fairyhouse, last Flat win was in 2023
runners.spotlight: Admirable veteran won a valuable handicap hurdle at Fairyhouse, bringing his overall career total to 12-69; last Flat win was in 2023 off a one-pound lower mark than this at the Curragh.

quotes.quote: You'd think Lord Erskine would be getting slower as he gets older and I thought they weren't going fast enough there and I was worried about the ground, but he proved me wrong. He's a great horse to have. I didn't believe he would ever win another race, but he has. He might end up in Punchestown, we'll see. He might go to Killarney for something on the Flat if he's still enjoying it - Harry Rogers, trainer.

quotes.race: Timeless Sash Windows Handicap Hurdle (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: I was a bit worried about the ground but Darragh (O'Keeffe) said it was no problem. I could never get Lord Erskine into a good race with a light weight and it was the same on the Flat. He'd a proper weight on his back today and there was a good gallop which suited him. His (late) owner Jerry Nolan was a pure gentleman. I rode winners for him and having an owner like him, you couldn't buy them - Harry Rogers, trainer.

quotes.race: Friends Of The Curragh Pollardstown Handicap
quotes.quote: We ran Lord Erskine at Listowel the other day and it just didn't work out. He does want two miles and that ground. I stuck the blinkers on him on Friday morning and that made the difference but he loves that ground and the trip. He's just easy to train and he's very laid-back, that's what's wrong with him, he just does what he wants and doesn't kill himself - Harry Rogers, trainer

quotes.race: Treo Eile Retraining Ireland's Racehorses Handicap
quotes.quote: We had to resort to plan B as Lord Erskine missed the break and had to sacrifice a couple of lengths to get him to the outside, but it worked out thankfully. That is his minimum trip as he is slow, but full of stamina. He was owned by the late Jerry Nolan and I'm delighted for connections - Harry is a big supporter of mine and himself and Miriam work very hard. I'm delighted for them. He is a yard stalwart, loves the track and is as genuine as they come.  - Siobhan Rutledge, rider.

quotes.race: BetVictor Run For Your Money Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: He's a decent horse on his day but he's had problems and it's just taken a long time to get him back. He was a bit keen today and the jumping seemed to wake him up a little bit. He handles that ground well and stays well. Hopefully things stay right with him, it's a long time since he won the Irish Cesarewitch here. He'll keep on going over the winter - Harry Rogers, trainer of Lord Erskine

quotes.race: Ryans Cleaning Event Specialists Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Lord Erskine is a nice horse and hopefully he can get another one. He's in again at Clonmel next week so we'll see how he comes out of this - Harry Rogers, trainer.

He's 18 in the ballot at Tipperary but that might bring him up a bit. He'll probably stay over hurdles for a while. He wants a dig in the ground and he wouldn't want it any quicker than that. Hopefully he might end up at Galway and if all goes well he'd scrape into the amateur race - Harry Rogers, trainer

He was weak when we got him but he has progressed very well. They went a decent gallop and that suited him. He's a good horse and we might head for the Naas November Handicap next. He does like a good ease in the ground - Harry Rogers, trainer

He wouldn't be in love with the ground but he got away with it. When they get off in front here it seems to be hard to catch them. He's in at Ballinrobe next Thursday over hurdles but he hasn't really taken to hurdles so far. We might be better off keeping him on the Flat and go back over hurdles next year -  Harry Rogers, trainer

He was unlucky in Tramore, Rachael Blackmore gave him a good ride but he was just too free. The plan was always to come here and when Pat Smullen is available, it's a help. He done it well and he's in at Navan on Saturday, where if there's any rain, he'll probably take his chance. The handicapper might give him 5lb or 6lb - Harry Rogers, trainer

runners.name: Sign From Above
runners.comment: Should be better for a recent hurdles start, bidding for a widely spaced Flat hat-trick
runners.spotlight: Should be better for a recent hurdles start; bidding for a widely spaced Flat hat-trick, won a 1m6f handicap at the 2023 Galway festival, and also successful at Listowel on only Flat start last season.

quotes.race: Bar One Racing Price Boost All Channels Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Sign From Above is a very consistent horse and never runs a bad race. He had two runs in Galway one day after the other and he ran a cracker both days. He'll be a nice horse there for nice handicaps - Peter Fahey, trainer.
Sign From Above is a lovely horse and he's very consistent. He'll end up having a nice mark over hurdles and he's a great horse to have fun with - Peter Fahey, trainer.

runners.name: Mordor
runners.breeder: S A S U Ecurie Des Monceaux
runners.comment: Useful dual-purpose sort, course 1m6f maiden winner last season, one of two for stable
runners.spotlight: Dual-purpose performer; won a 1m6f course maiden last July, beating The Banger Doyle; also won twice over hurdles last summer; respectable eighth in Martin Pipe before third of six in 1m6f Navan handicap; the trainer also runs Zanahiyr.

runners.name: Curious Bride

prev_owners.owner: Eoin Banville & K Bolger & Peter Robin Parkhill

runners.comment: Won two staying handicaps on turf last season, solid third at Dundalk three months ago
runners.spotlight: Came back to form over staying trips last summer, winning at Limerick and Clonmel over 2m1f; solid third at Dundalk three months ago; suited by good ground.

quotes.race: Private Suites At Limerick Racecourse Handicap
quotes.quote: Curious Bride stays well but Colin said she doesn't necessarily need to go that far. She had a going day today and we'll see what the handicapper does with her - Eamonn O'Connell, trainer
Curious Bride had the experience which stood to her and she got into a lovely rhythm. She jumped well and galloped all the way to the line. The further she goes the better - Sean Flanagan, rider.

runners.name: The Banger Doyle
runners.comment: Bumper/chase winner, very little between him and Robbies Rock on Tipperary running
runners.spotlight: Bumper and three-time chase winner is a maiden over hurdles and on the Flat; very little between him and Robbies Rock on Tipperary running, with Mo Chille Mar on their heels.

quotes.quote: Turning in, I wasn't sure how much Alex (Harvey, on Dollar Value) had left but he stayed going. I didn't think it was over coming to the last. The Banger Doyle doesn't find a whole lot off the bridle as he stays going the same speed so I was trying to keep him on it as long as I could. He seems to be a bridesmaid a lot of the time so he deserved that - Michael O'Sullivan, rider, speaking to Racing TV.

The Banger Doyle is a horse that never runs a bad horse but for some reason he seems to get beaten. He gave an exhibition of jumping. He is still a maiden over hurdles and is rated much lower, so he should be able to win a handicap hurdle - John Queally, trainer.

runners.name: Zanahiyr
runners.breeder: His Highness The Aga Khan's Studs S C
runners.comment: High-class jumper has his first Flat run since 2020 maiden win, potentially well treated
runners.spotlight: High-class jumper; third in the Champion Hurdle in 2023; better hurdler than chaser, though managed a fine third in last year's Galway Plate; now has his first Flat run since 2020 maiden win over 1m4f at Fairyhouse; potentially well treated.

quotes.quote: It was a good performance and I suppose Zanahiyr was really only getting going at the finish. He is a good age now, gets further than two miles so I'm delighted that he got his head in front. He can step up in distance but is also okay over a strongly run two miles so there are plenty of options - Jack Kennedy, jockey

I thought Zanahiyr was very beatable on his first run back. Jack said he took a couple of blows, but he jumped well so I thought it was a nice performance. There is a lot of prize-money to be picked up in these conditions hurdles and he has no Grade 1 penalty, so he could step back into a Grade 2 or 3. I'd say you could see him over any trip from two miles to two miles five furlongs - Gordon Elliott, speaking to Racing TV.

quotes.race: Unibet Champion Hurdle Challenge Trophy (Grade 1) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I thought Zanahiyr ran a very good race. He galloped well and we're very happy with him - Gordon Elliott, trainer.

Zanahiyr did that well. He wasn't really doing very much, his ears were pricked the whole way, but it was very pleasing how he galloped to the line from the second-last. I can see him stepping up in trip at some stage this season - Gordon Elliott, trainer.

It was a great performance from him. It was a completely opposite race to the last day at Fairyhouse, we went very steady and he still won so it just shows that he can do it anyway. He only did what he had to do today, we're delighted with him. I think Quilixios is very good but this horse might edge it over him - Jack Kennedy, rider of Zanahiyr

quotes.race: Bar One Racing Price Boost Juvenile Hurdle (Grade 3)
quotes.quote: We thought he was nice at home. He did it well at Ballinrobe, and we thought he had come on for it. You're always a bit nervous when you see Willie [Mullins] taking you on with a dual winner out of France, so I thought it was a very good performance. Jack [Kennedy] said he travelled and jumped. He did everything very easily. He's not just a juvenile, he's big and strong and only going to get better - Gordon Elliott, trainer of Zanahiyr

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF C & G Maiden
quotes.quote: He's a lovely big horse. He was very babyish and even in Navan he really only got the hang of things up the hill. I knew he'd come on from it and he was a lot more on the ball today. I'll give him a bit of a chance now and we'll take it from there. He's a horse with a future. He stays well and has a great attitude. I'd say he's going to keep on improving and he has the scope to do it - Michael Halford, trainer of Zanahiyr

stable_tour.quote: He's ran very well at a few festivals and we've purposely kept him fresh for it this year. He hasn't run since November. Something like the Ultima might suit him. 19-2-25

runners.name: Robbies Rock
runners.comment: Second in the Fred Winter, should be suited by this step up in trip after Navan fourth
runners.spotlight: Won a 1m6f Navan handicap last year and second over 1m4f at the Listowel festival; turned into a useful hurdler over the winter and was runner-up in the Fred Winter at Cheltenham; should be suited by this step up in trip after Navan fourth over 1m4f that matches him closely with The Banger Doyle and Mo Chille Mar.

quotes.race: Hallgarten And Novum Wines Juvenile Handicap Hurdle (Registered As Fred Winter) (Premier Hcap) (GBB)
quotes.quote: Robbies Rock ran really well. He was flat out everywhere and had to take the brave man's route, but he stayed on really well and got to the line - Gavin Cromwell, trainer.

Robbies Rock is a very big, raw horse and hopefully there is a bit of improvement there. For a horse that has had a few runs, he's still fairly raw but he went to the line well - Gavin Cromwell, trainer.

runners.name: Dark Note
runners.comment: Interesting here after charity race win at Punchestown, had been running over jumps
runners.spotlight: Three-time Flat winner; spent the winter over jumps; of some interest here after charity race win at Punchestown.

quotes.race: Killyhevlin Lakeside Hotel & Lodges Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Dark Note had a very good run last time. I knew Jack was under pressure when he came alongside me. He probably got a head in front of me but me fellow ran all the way to the line - Cian Quirke, rider.

quotes.race: John Madden & Sons Apprentice Claiming Race
quotes.quote: I was happy enough. Dark Note got a lovely position all the way around in the box seat. I got a lovely split but I probably went too early. He got very lairy when he got to the front, I could've covered him up for a bit longer.  But look he got the job done and he done it well - Jake Coen, jockey.

runners.name: San Salvador
runners.comment: Better known as a jumper; AW winner in January but against classier rivals here
runners.spotlight: Smart jumper who won a Grade 2 novice chase last September and added an AW maiden to his tally in January; last seen finishing tailed off in a handicap at the Cheltenham Festival; tackles far better opposition here than for that Dundalk win.

quotes.race: Ballymore Group Irish EBF Kilbegnet Novice Chase (Grade 3)
quotes.quote: San Salvador is improving and was good at Listowel the other day. He's rated 135 over hurdles, and he's going to be something similar over fences. Just niggly things held him up, but he's getting a clean run at it now. Stalking away seems to suit him and he'll have no bother getting two and a half miles - JJ Slevin, jockey, speaking to Racing TV.
San Salvador jumped better. He has always had plenty of ability and got it all together today - Sean Corby, assistant trainer.

quotes.race: tote.ie Never Beaten By SP Tara Handicap Hurdle (Grade B)
quotes.quote: San Salvador ran very well at Cork last time. The race worked out lovely for him today. He was able to get a lovely position, and apart from one mistake down the back he jumped very well through the race. He'll probably go up plenty for that, he might have to go up a bit to get into a race like the Coral Cup, but he will be going for another good pot somewhere in the spring - Joseph O'Brien, trainer.

It was very straightforward with San Salvador. He obviously won a bumper last time but it was a fair ask to win on his first run over hurdles ridden as positively as I was on him. I thought turning for home I was after overdoing it - and I probably did a bit - but in fairness to the horse, he didn't lie down and is hardy. He had good winter form last year, isn't slow and when he's in a good rhythm, he keeps going - JJ Slevin, rider.

quotes.race: Daily Jackpots At BoyleSports Vegas INH Flat Race
quotes.quote: San Salvador is quite a tall horse and still quite weak, but I thought he had every right to win that. He jumps very well so I would say he will go straight over hurdles - Brendan Powell, assistant trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He ran well on his first start over fences at Limerick in May and will come back for a novice chase either next month or in the new year. He'll definitely be capable of plying his trade well in novice chases this season. 27-11-23

runners.name: Comic Book
runners.comment: Underwhelming return but has a massive chance on last season's peak efforts
runners.spotlight: Has only won a Bellewstown maiden (1m4f, good) but she's smart having held her own in Listed and Group 3 races last year (1m4f/1m6f); made an underwhelming return at Cork (1m4f Listed) and cheekpieces now go on, but clearly a strong contender if back on song.

stable_tour.quote: The ground was just too quick for her at Cork. We now know not to run her on quick ground. She doesn't want extremes. We think there could be a big race in this filly over a mile and a half or further. She only came good in the middle of last summer and we've got to wait for her to come to herself but we think she's a good filly. 23-04-25

runners.name: War Rooms
runners.comment: Third in last year's Dante; encouraging debut for this yard and should build on that
runners.spotlight: This week last year he finished third to Economics in the Dante at York, which wasn't his only smart piece of form for Owen Burrows; changed hands for 155,000gns in October and gelded; returned from 234 days off to push the evergreen veteran Falcon Eight close over this trip at Gowran and fully entitled to come on for that.

quotes.race: Al Basti Equiworld Dubai Dante Stakes (Group 2)
quotes.quote: That was what I expected at Sandown. We were disappointed there but nothing went to plan there and Jim was quick to say put a line through that. I was more favouring going to Newbury on Saturday but fair play to the owners, they were rewarded. The winner looks really smart but we were beaten not far by a Group 1 winner last year. War Rooms won't go to Epsom and we'll keep him for Royal Ascot for the Hampton Court. He's still learning and Jim said we might do more harm than good for the future if we were to go to Epsom - Owen Burrows, trainer.

quotes.race: Simon Piggott Memorial Race EBF Novice Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: War Rooms gave me a good feel. They went a strong pace on the ground and he stayed well. He'll have learnt plenty and has got a good mind on him. He's rangy and will be a lovely horse for next year. Over a mile and a quarter he'll be quite smart - Jim Crowley, jockey, talking to Sky Sports Racing.

runners.name: Jet Setting Jim
runners.comment: Bumper/hurdle winner who was running well over fences until last time (burst)
runners.spotlight: Bumper/hurdle winner who has been chasing for his last four starts, running two decent races at Galway; pulled up in a novice chase last time (September) but burst a blood vessel and he was a much shorter price that day than the winner San Salvador (competing off level weights).

runners.name: Liss Eile
runners.comment: Beaten in four bumpers and 200-1 when tailed off in a 1m2f Cork maiden last month
runners.spotlight: Beaten in four bumpers and 200-1 when tailed off in a 1m2f Cork maiden last month.

runners.name: Patrick Street
runners.comment: Mild debut promise hurdling but backward step 8 days later; more one for handicaps
runners.spotlight: Modest enough Flat winner ran creditably on hurdling debut at Naas last month but took a backward step at Ballinrobe eight days later; more likely of interest in handicaps.

runners.name: At The Wings
runners.comment: Best bumper effort when second here last summer on soft; may need this comeback run
runners.spotlight: Much the pick of four bumper runs when a clear second here over 2m2f (soft) last summer; absent since September and may need this on hurdles debut.

runners.name: Big Tom
runners.comment: Well held both maiden runs, can only be watched for now
runners.spotlight: Tailed off on sole start in 2023 and not seen until soon beaten in decent 2m4f Naas maiden in March; can only be watched for now.

runners.name: Faithful Follower
runners.comment: Some promise in bumpers, not one to rule out on hurdles debut
runners.spotlight: Much the best of five bumper runs when clear second at Down Royal last autumn (good-to-yielding); Wexford comeback run in March well below that level but not one to rule out here on hurdles debut.

runners.name: Kamino Bello
runners.comment: Soon beaten on bumper debut; respected nonetheless from top yard now switched to hurdles
runners.spotlight: Distant third in a point-to-point, soon beaten on rules debut in Fairyhouse bumper in January when not without market support; respected nonetheless from top yard now switched to hurdles.

runners.name: Maroto
runners.owner: Denis Omahony & Daibheid Mchugh & Desmond J Kelly

prev_owners.owner: Thomas B Breen & Roderick Ryan & M D Minch

runners.comment: Hard to be confident in but old form would give him a big chance if handling ground
runners.spotlight: Formerly with Willie Mullins; ran well in defeat several times in maidens (albeit on softer ground) but well beaten in both runs for current yard over the winter, hooded last time; not one to be confident in but if able to return to former level of form would have a major chance in what looks a weak maiden.

runners.name: Monnow Valley
runners.comment: Of no account on the flat and nothing so far in three attempts hurdling; cheekpieces tried
runners.spotlight: Of no account on the flat and nothing so far in three attempts hurdling; cheekpieces tried.

runners.name: No Demand
runners.comment: Newcomer of limited appeal on breeding
runners.spotlight: Gatewood 6yo is fifth foal; dam unraced half sister to Italian 7f/1m winner Dribbling, out of half-sister to US 1m2f stakes winner Sans Ecocide; not an obvious one to make an immediate impact.

runners.name: Parkgarve
runners.comment: Half-brother to Slade Steel; well held in bumper a year ago; headgear tried on return
runners.spotlight: Half-brother to very smart 2m-2m4f novice hurdler (inc Supreme Novices') Slade Steel; dam 2m4f hurdle winner, half-sister to 2m4f hurdle winner Missoula; keen, soon beaten on debut in Down Royal bumper a year ago; headgear combination fitted for hurdles debut and market should be informative.

runners.name: Saint Peregrine
runners.comment: Shaped better on hurdles debut 8 days ago; needs to settle better though
runners.spotlight: Headstrong sort well held twice in bumpers (ran out on debut) but shaped better in 2m2f Down Royal maiden hurdle eight days ago, again keen when midfield; if settling better could play a role here.

runners.name: San Franco
runners.comment: Roscommon run last summer gives him a big shout in this weak maiden if handling ground
runners.spotlight: Some promise in bumpers and set for second when last flight faller on hurdles debut at Roscommon last summer (soft); probably needed recent comeback run and should be capable of a big run here, if handling quicker conditions.

runners.name: Shore
runners.comment: Of no account on the Flat and two hurdle runs have been poor; back from 2-year absence
runners.spotlight: Of no account on the Flat and two hurdle runs have been poor; back from near two-year absence.

runners.name: Florida Taiga
runners.comment: Not an obvious one but potential improver having switched yards
runners.spotlight: Limited maiden under both codes, not totally disgraced in two hurdling attempts last September; first start for new yard and can't be entirely ruled out.

6:00.race_name: DecoClip Construction Company Mares Maiden Hurdle

runners.name: Encosta
runners.comment: Better for recent hurdles debut in a stronger maiden; handles ground, don't rule out
runners.spotlight: Dual winner on the Flat (including on good ground); didn't count but gave the impression she would benefit from the experience when fair 7th of 22 on last month's hurdles debut at Fairyhouse; runs against her own sex here in what appears a weaker maiden so don't rule out.

runners.name: Kabylia
runners.breeder: Suc E Bec De La Motte & J Bruneau De La Salle
runners.comment: Much improved in hood to win recent Kilbeggan bumper; likely major player on hurdles debut
runners.spotlight: Point-to-point second came good on third bumper start when landing Kilbeggan mares' contest last month, much improved in first-time hood to win with plenty in hand (good-to-yielding); likely major player now switched to hurdles.

runners.name: Belle Of Boston
runners.comment: Tailed off on last month's hurdles debut at Ballinrobe; can only be watched for now
runners.spotlight: Fourth foal; dam unraced half-sister to winners Sego Success (useful 3m-3m1f hurdle/chase), Dorans Boy (2m3f hurdle) and Benefitthewest (2m/2m3f hurdle); novicey jumping, tailed off on last month's hurdles debut at Ballinrobe; can only be watched for now.

runners.name: Irish Music
runners.breeder: Mme Laure Giethlen Cadiergues & M Didier Giethlen
runners.comment: 80,000Euros 3yo; debutante for whom market may prove best guide
runners.spotlight: No Risk At All mare cost 80,000Euros as a 3yo; second foal; dam French 2m3f chase winner, half-sister to useful winners Highway To Hell (French 2m1f-2m3f hurdle; by No Risk At All) and Five O'Clock (2m-2m5f hurdle); debutante for whom market may prove best guide.

runners.name: Kate Knows Best
runners.breeder: S O Berry & C J Berry
runners.comment: Lame when last seen last summer, previous C&D second gives her major claims
runners.spotlight: Ran well in bumpers and runner-up on opening maiden hurdle runs last summer at Killarney (good) and over C&D (soft) when tending to jump left; absent since returning lame and distressed when beaten favourite at Ballinrobe in late August but goes well fresh and has to be on the shortlist.

runners.name: Lilac Lady
runners.comment: Poor flat maiden for Michael Grassick; debuts over hurdles for new yard
runners.spotlight: Poor flat maiden for Michael Grassick although did finish second in 1m6f Gowran handicap on good ground last summer; debuts over hurdles for new yard.

runners.name: Niamhie
runners.comment: Last of 11 on debut in Naas bumper in November, can only be watched on return
runners.spotlight: Half-sister to 2m-2m3f hurdle/chase winner Ciankyle; dam placed 1m AW, half-sister to winners Kinger Rocks (bumper, 1m4f/1m6f Flat and 2m hurdle) and John Magical (bumper/2m hurdle); last of 11 on debut in Naas bumper in November, can only be watched on return now switched to hurdles.

runners.name: Sinceyouvebeengone
runners.comment: Modest point form, most recently second in 2-runner Tattersalls Farm mares maiden
runners.spotlight: Vadamos mare is first foal of a 2m hurdle winner; modest point-to-point form, most recently second in 2-runner Tattersalls Farm mares maiden last month.

runners.name: Tolovelyoldmiltown
runners.comment: Poor form in three maiden hurdle runs of late; best wait for handicaps
runners.spotlight: Poor form in three maiden hurdle runs of late; awaiting a handicap mark.

runners.name: Two Become One
runners.comment: Runner-up in Kilbeggan maiden a year ago after a break; has to be considered major player
runners.spotlight: Displayed definite ability when runner-up (after 173-day absence) in 2m3f Kilbeggan maiden a year ago, staying on well (good-to-yielding); runs well fresh so has to be considered a major player.

runners.name: Wild Mandate
runners.comment: Bumper second here last summer has to jump better than on hurdles debut though
runners.spotlight: Some useful bumper form, especially when collared late here last summer (2m3f, good); none too fluent when last seen on hurdles debut in November but still respected given that bumper form.

runners.name: The Truant
runners.comment: C&D winner last summer in good heart on the flat of late; top-weight respected
runners.spotlight: Was ending a three-year hiatus on the flat when scoring over 1m6f at Navan last month and followed up with good second at same venue; just 1-16 over hurdles, that win coming over C&D last summer (good) off 96; in good heart and top-weight is respected.

runners.name: High Honour
runners.comment: C&D winner last summer; good recent Kilbeggan run, place claims
runners.spotlight: Lost form after C&D win last August (soft) off 98 until much improved when chasing home a ready winner at Leopardstown in March; decent third at Kilbeggan last time and place claims again.

quotes.quote: High Honour travelled for me all the way, just coming over the second-last he went to lug in, but when I pulled him out he got rolling for me. He was good and game - John Shinnick, rider.

quotes.race: European Breeders Fund EBF Peter Willett Future Stayers' Maiden Stakes (Sire/Dam Restricted) (GBB)
quotes.quote: High Honour is a nice staying horse who was green last time but has come on from that - William Buick, rider.

runners.name: Seasett
runners.comment: Back to winning mark and yard in good form; don't rule out
runners.spotlight: Lost his way after winning two 2m3f hurdles a year ago but, having rejoined Shark Hanlon, took step back in right direction at Limerick last month; poor Warwick run since tempers enthusiasm but yard in good form.

quotes.race: Racing TV Profits Returned To Racing Handicap
quotes.quote: Seasett's work had been good and we think he has a bit more speed than his previous yard gave him credit for. He'll be a really fun horse this year - Charlie Fellowes, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He was with Richard Fahey last term, but his first race for us, last month at Nottingham, was an impressive winning one. We dropped him back to 1mÂ½f from 1m2f and he did it nicely, and when David [Egan] got off he said that he had tons of boot and could drop back further if needed. We then took him to Chelmsford on Saturday where he met trouble in running before finishing seventh after being sent off joint-favourite. He is one readers would do well to keep on side this season. 18-05-22

runners.name: St Anthonys Corner
runners.comment: More encouraging signs off reduced mark of late; more required
runners.spotlight: A 50-1 winner on racecourse debut in 2m1f Ballinrobe maiden a year ago (good) when hooded; has generally struggled in handicaps since, although more encouraging signs off reduced mark of late; more required.

runners.name: Applejack Poet
runners.comment: Long losing run but better for recent comeback run
runners.spotlight: Sole hurdles win came at Bellewstown in 2023 (good); back down to same mark now after last month's comeback run at same venue; others preferred.

runners.name: Stormy Jenn
runners.comment: Better on flat; plenty to find on Limerick run when last seen in November
runners.spotlight: Dual-purpose mare whose two flat wins came at Gowran; 0-5 hurdling, plenty to find on Limerick run when last seen in November.

runners.name: Three Tribes
runners.comment: Well-beaten in three maidens and opening two handicap efforts no better
runners.spotlight: Well-beaten in three maidens and opening two handicap efforts no better.

runners.name: Moulane West
runners.comment: Several placings here; on an okay mark but lack of a recent run a negative
runners.spotlight: Bumper winner but 0-26 hurdling, numerous placings including three time at this venue, most recently in October when last seen; on an okay mark but lack of a recent run a possible negative.

runners.name: Sydney Cruiser
runners.comment: Place claims but more needed to play a major role
runners.spotlight: A 17-race maiden but has made the frame a few times on this sort of ground, including on Navan return last month; fortnight later not as good at Clonmel when not much luck in running; place claims but more needed to play a major role.

runners.name: Highland Earl
runners.comment: Yet to trouble the judge, including five attempts hurdling; others preferred
runners.spotlight: Yet to trouble the judge in bumpers and five attempts hurdling, latest two in 2m handicaps; others preferred.

runners.name: My Good Pal
runners.comment: Too keen when beaten favourite at Clonmel; back from a break and may yet improve
runners.spotlight: Ordinary form, including second start for current yard when well-backed favourite at Clonmel in January, racing far too keenly; back from a break and may yet improve.

runners.name: Go Gill Go
runners.comment: Long losing run, hard to see her playing a major role
runners.spotlight: Losing run since maiden hurdle win in 2021; couple of Clonmel placings but hard to fancy her making a big play here.

quotes.quote: Go Gill Go ran well at Wexford over too long a trip. She saw it out well today. She will handle better ground and we will try and find a handicap hurdle somewhere - James Grace, trainer.

runners.name: Tir Og
runners.comment: Faller when at front two out at Clonmel; 4yo could have more to offer off same mark
runners.spotlight: Lightly raced 4yo placed on handicap debut at Clonmel in February and was running better race at same venue following month, in front and being pressed when faller two out (good); could have more to offer off same mark here.

7:00.race_name: Enda McGoldrick, Plant & Agri Hire Maiden Hurdle

runners.name: Cordal Boy
runners.comment: Beaten 75l at 125-1 on debut at Fairyhouse, reportedly never travelled, can only watch
runners.spotlight: Kingston Hill gelding didn't show much when beaten 75l at 125-1 on debut at Fairyhouse; jockey reported he never travelled; can only be watched after that.

runners.name: Garadice
runners.comment: Kingston Hill gelding pulled up both starts in points, hard to fancy on hurdles bow
runners.spotlight: Kingston Hill gelding related to Flat winners but pulled up in both starts in point-to-points at Belclare and Oldcastle in March; hard to fancy on hurdles debut.

runners.name: Gold Gatewood
runners.comment: Never involved when pulled up at Limerick, tongue tie goes on, hard to make a case for
runners.spotlight: Always behind when pulled up on debut at Limerick (2m3f, soft) when sent off at 150-1; tongue tie now tried; difficult to make a case for.

runners.name: Grandy Lane
runners.comment: No impact in two starts in points, tongue tie tried for hurdles debut, best watched
runners.spotlight: Shirocco gelding was pulled up and beaten 35l in two starts in point-to-points; tongue tied for hurdles debut; best watched.

runners.name: Huntsgrove
runners.comment: Rated 109, fine second after a 263 day break latest, strip fitter now, leading claims
runners.spotlight: Rated 109 after four starts in maiden hurdles; placed on last three starts; best effort yet when a 2.25l second of 16 after a 263 day absence at Kilbeggan (19.5f, yielding) last month; will strip fitter for that and good ground fine; leading claims.

runners.name: Irinas Path
runners.comment: Rated 106, good second on penultimate, off since pulling up over 3m last August, chance
runners.spotlight: One of two for yard; rated 106 after five starts in maiden hurdles; solid effort on penultimate at Roscommon (2m4f, yld-sft) when a 3.5l second of 15; pulled up when trying 3m when last seen at Kilbeggan in August of last year; has gone well fresh before; considered dropped back in trip.

runners.name: Jumble Light
runners.breeder: M Michel Bourgneuf & E A R L Les Marronniers
runners.comment: Promise in bumpers for former yard, shaped like this trip would suit latest, place chance
runners.spotlight: Showed promise in a couple of bumpers last year for John Hayes; 40-1 and beaten 12.5l on first start for this yard after 325 day absence at Kilbeggan (15.5f, gd-yld); shaped like further would suit that day; place chance upped in trip.

runners.name: Killala Bay
runners.comment: Long odds and ran accordingly in three maidens, steps up in trip, may need more time
runners.spotlight: Triple-figure odds and has run accordingly in a trio of maiden hurdles at 15.5f-17.5f; step up in trip not an obvious move; may need more time.

runners.name: Kinturk Nelson
runners.comment: No impact on testing ground in a pair of Navan maiden hurdles, probably one for handicaps
runners.spotlight: No impact in a pair of maidens at Navan at 22.5f and 2m on heavy and soft ground; half-brother has run well on good ground so may do better on this sounder surface but is probably one for handicaps.

runners.name: Marian Place
runners.comment: Home-bred Ocovango gelding, dam won a maiden hurdle, worth a market check on debut
runners.spotlight: Home-bred Ocovango gelding is a first foal; dam 2m hurdle-2m4f chase winner, sister to bumper-2m hurdle winner Minnies Secret, half-sister to winners Aodhan May (2m4f-3m1f hurdle-chase) and Mary B (bumper), out of point/2m6f hurdle winner; worth a market check on debut.

runners.name: Mystical Sandmason
runners.comment: Sandmason gelding, dam a 2m maiden hurdle winner, this trip might stretch, check market
runners.spotlight: Gelded son of Sandmason is a second foal; dam 2m-2m1f hurdle winner, is granddaughter of 7f-2m Flat/useful 2m hurdle winner; this trip might stretch on debut but worth a market check.

runners.name: Welcome Back
runners.comment: Point winner, fell on Rules' debut in a Thurles hunter chase, can't be fully discounted
runners.spotlight: Second runner for yard; won a point-to-point at Tinahely (subsequent bumper winner 6.75l behind in third); 11-2 when jumping poorly and falling on Rules' debut in a Thurles maiden hunter chase in March; not discounted on hurdles debut.

runners.name: Whiskey On Ice
runners.comment: Not disgraced when fifth on debut but beaten 18l, steps up in trip, minor place chance
runners.spotlight: Slipped up in sole point-to-point at Toomebridge; not disgraced when fifth of 17 at 20-1 on hurdles debut at Down Royal eight days ago but still beaten 18l; should improve for that and steps up in trip; minor place claims.

runners.name: Steps In The Sand
runners.comment: C&D winner, remains 2lb above last victory, out of form since return from break
runners.spotlight: Won back to back races last July, including over C&D; raised a cumulative total of 13lb for those victories and remains 2lb above her last win; hasn't shown enough in two runs for this yard since returning from five months off to make her of interest here.

runners.name: The Striker Dylan
runners.comment: 0-9, run well in defeat last four starts at 2m1f-2m7f, up 2lb for latest second, go well
runners.spotlight: Nine race maiden but has been knocking on the door in recent starts at 2m1f to 2m7f on good and yielding ground; beaten 5l into second of 11 at Killarney latest off 95; up 2lb for that but should continue to give a good account.

runners.name: Evans Secret
runners.comment: 0-8 over hurdles, should strip fitter for latest run, not without a chance for local yard
runners.spotlight: Dual-purpose maiden is 0-8 over timber; went close at Ballinrobe (2m6f) and Roscommon (3m) last May-June in this headgear combination; should strip fitter for his last run when a respectable fifth at Ballinrobe; not without a chance with the blinkers back on for local yard.

runners.name: Smackwater Jack
runners.comment: Best effort for current yard on latest on soft, up 1lb, obvious chance if handling ground
runners.spotlight: 1-17 over hurdles, the win coming back in 2019 for Olly Murphy; best effort yet for current yard on latest, a neck second of 16 at Gowran (2m4f, soft) 66 days ago; different ground to contend with here, obvious chance off 1lb higher if handling it.

stable_tour.quote: He had a very good start over fences at Aintree but has missed 18 months. He's back in good form now and we'll start in a handicap chase with him in about six weeks. He could become a very nice staying chaser. 27-10-22

runners.name: True Destiny
runners.breeder: M J & L A Taylor Llp

prev_owners.owner: Exors Of The Late Sultan Ahmad Sha
H R H Sultan Ahmad Shah

runners.comment: Veteran, two time C&D winner, 4lb below last success, cheekpieces back on, thereabouts
runners.spotlight: Dual-purpose veteran has won eight races, two of them over C&D; good effort latest at Naas when not quite getting home over 3m; is now 4lb below his last C&D win and he acts on good ground; thereabouts with the cheekpieces back on (went close in them here in October).

runners.name: Divilabother
runners.comment: 0-11 but has run well in defeat, has placed C&D form, good run after break latest, go well
runners.spotlight: 0-11 but has run well in defeat in five of his last seven starts including two solid efforts at this venue; found just one too good after a 169 day break when a 2.5l second of 10 at Fairyhouse (2m4f, yielding) last time; nudged up 4lb, which seems harsh, but should go well again.

runners.name: Dunany Point
runners.comment: Made all at Bellewstown, up 7lb, should make another bold bid from the front
runners.spotlight: Off the mark in fine style when making all off 81 at Bellewstown (20.5f, good) last month; up 7lb and likely to make another bold bid from the front; should be on the premises.

runners.name: Mighty Soldier
runners.comment: 0-7 over timber, best effort on heavy, faded over 2m6f last time, needs more
runners.spotlight: 0-7 over hurdles; best effort a 10.5l third of 17 on heavy over 19.5f at Punchestown in January; faded over 2m6f when ridden positively last time; needs more.

runners.name: Evies Court
runners.comment: Long odds and well beaten all six starts including in a handicap, hard to fancy
runners.spotlight: Long odds for all six starts and has failed to trouble the judge; beaten 83l in sole handicap start at Bellewstown; another heavy defeat back in a maiden latest; hard to fancy.

runners.name: Ben Purple
runners.comment: Failed to complete four of six starts, reluctant to race last time, a risky proposition
runners.spotlight: Has failed to complete four of his six starts, including when refusing to race in a Roscommon bumper last August; reluctant at the start again when pulled up on handicap debut latest; a risky proposition.

runners.name: Cois Fharraige
runners.comment: Showed little in six starts in 2024, off 246 days, watch on yard debut unless backed
runners.spotlight: Showed very little in six starts for Norman Lee last year, including in two handicaps; probably best watched on first run for new yard after a 246 day absence unless the market speaks.

runners.name: Mr Mcwhinny
runners.owner: Jeffrey Brennan & John Cawley & Natalie Gilligan
runners.comment: 0-9 over hurdles, ran well off 6lb higher at Fairyhouse, poor since, others preferred
runners.spotlight: 0-9 over hurdles; standout effort came when a 7.5l second of 16 at Fairyhouse (3m, good) in November off 88; failed to back that up in three runs since and was beaten 44l at Ballinrobe on latest last month; down another 3lb but others appeal more.

runners.name: Restless Son
runners.comment: Best effort to date on latest over 2m2f, stamina a query for this trip, others appeal more
runners.spotlight: 0-9 over hurdles; posted best effort to date on latest when an 8l fourth of 14 at Kilbeggan (2m2f, gd-yld); down 1lb for that but didn't shape like he was crying out for this longer trip; others have more pressing claims.

runners.name: Cornmarket
runners.comment: Maiden, best efforts for former yard on heavy, pulled up when last seen, best watched
runners.spotlight: Dual-purpose maiden is 0-12 over hurdles; best efforts for former yard on testing ground; pulled up when last seen in January at Naas; best watched on first start for new stable.

runners.name: Pension Plan
runners.comment: Long odds and showed little in maidens, may do better now handicapping, check market
runners.spotlight: Long odds and didn't show a whole lot in maidens; may find his level now handicapping off basement mark; worth a market check.

runners.name: Manhattan Brook
runners.comment: Much improved at Kilbeggan latest, drop back in trip a plus on that effort, each way shout
runners.spotlight: Looked of little account in first seven starts but much improved performance when an 11l fourth of 16 off this mark at Kilbeggan (24.5f, yielding) last time; the drop back to 2m4f is a plus on that evidence; each way claims.

runners.name: Klassman
runners.comment: 0-14, has run well in defeat, ground and trip to blame latest, go well if gets in; reserve
runners.spotlight: First reserve; 0-14 over hurdles but has run well in defeat; only beaten 2l when third of 15 at Ballinrobe on penultimate; yielding ground and 3m trip to blame for latest; could go well if getting a run.

runners.name: Run Away Merida
runners.comment: Long odds and no impact in maidens, not obviously well treated for h'cap debut, watch
runners.spotlight: Second reserve; long odds and never figured in four maiden hurdles at 2m-17.5f; not obviously well treated on handicap debut; watch.

8:00.race_name: Kevin Egan Cars Peugeot Citreon Handicap Hurdle

runners.name: Masterboy Davis
runners.breeder: M Claude Quellier, M Alan Quellier & Mme Svetlana Timon-Quel
runners.comment: Cork maiden third but latest Limerick maiden run raises questions on handicap debut
runners.spotlight: Good bumper form last season and pick of four attempts hurdling when clear third in 3m Cork maiden; tame Limerick effort last time raises questions, however; now switched to handicap company.

stable_tour.quote: He works a hell of a lot better than he's shown. It just didn't happen for him in bumpers last season for whatever reason, but I'm expecting a lot more from him when he goes over hurdles. Don't give up on him. 28-10-24

runners.name: The Miracle Man
runners.owner: A Trappe & Declan Trappe & Garry Trappe & James J Gallagher
runners.comment: Still on a fair mark and return to better ground, along with drop in class could suit
runners.spotlight: Won over 2m4f here earlier last October (yielding) and career-best in winning 3m Fairyhouse contest last month on decent ground; left with fair bit to do when staying on sixth on softer ground in valuable novice handicap at same venue; probably still on a fair mark and return to better ground, along with drop in class could suit.

quotes.race: Whistlin' Donkeys @ Fairyhouse Easter Saturday Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: The Miracle Man is a tough horse, he's from that Carrigeen [Kamala] family and they stay. He seems to like that ground. At one stage I was thinking we might let him off but they wouldn't be running on faster than that during the summer so we'll keep him out for a while - Arthur Moore, trainer.

runners.name: Killinure Lass
runners.comment: Bit to find on both recent comeback runs off a still high enough mark
runners.spotlight: Four-time hurdles winner for previous yards at up to 3m, most recently at Bellewstown a year ago off 100; bit to find on both recent comeback runs.

quotes.quote: Killinure Lass got awfully lonesome on the run-in but luckily the line came in time. She was unlucky to bump into Ishan at Punchestown when she ran a belter and wasn't winning out of turn - Brian McMahon, trainer.

runners.name: Shotgun Jack
runners.comment: Absent for a year until recent Ballinrobe run; better for that and 4lb lower
runners.spotlight: Both wins in '23/'24 season came on soft/heavy; back from year's absence when forcing most until dropping out before last at Ballinrobe last month; better for that run and down 4lb.

runners.name: Betty Dutton
runners.comment: Consistent sort in handicaps last season on all types of ground; place claims again
runners.spotlight: Hasn't added to Roscommon maiden win but plenty of placings in handicaps, most recently over 3m at Cork in March (good); has her chance again but clearly hard to win with.

quotes.race: Thomas A. Murray Bar Roscommon Mares' Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Betty Dutton might not do a lot more this year but I hope she will be a good mare in the spring - Edward O'Grady, trainer.

runners.name: Irish Envoy

prev_owners.owner: D W McCorkell & Susan McDowell & J P Fitzgerald & G Howitt

runners.comment: Long losing run and absent since August but has ground to suit
runners.spotlight: Runs off the same mark as when gaining sole hurdles win in 2m4f Punchestown handicap in October 2023; off since unseating in a handicap chase at Wexford last August; ground to suit.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF (Pro/Am) Auction INH Flat Race (IRE Incentive Race)
quotes.quote: Irish Envoy was green and babyish and was barely ready for a run. I thought the advantages of running before Punchestown out-weighed the disadvantages. He'll go for the Land Rover now - Liz Doyle, trainer.

runners.name: Cosmo Renfro
runners.comment: Out of form last season and prefers it much softer so opposable
runners.spotlight: Very consistent '23/24 season, rounding off campaign with 2m3f Limerick handicap hurdle win (soft to heavy) off 99; well below that form this past season and although slipping back down the handicap remains opposable.

runners.name: Roxboro River
runners.comment: Improvement upped in trip last time at Warwick; this more competitive
runners.spotlight: Maiden showed improvement when upped in trip on latest in 4-runner 3m1f Warwick handicap last month, chasing home a ready winner after mistake two out (good); this more competitive.

runners.name: Lets Do This
runners.comment: Maiden twice placed over C&D; goes on good ground, definite claims on comeback
runners.spotlight: Maiden but only touched off over C&D in 2023 off 93 and in good form last summer when last seen, C&D third and good third in competitive Galway contest; tongue-tie replaces usual hood and could go well.

runners.name: Arrycan
runners.comment: Better chaser but has to remain of interest off this mark with trip/ground to suit
runners.spotlight: All four wins have been over fences on decent ground; lightly raced last year, pick of form when second in 3m Roscommon handicap hurdle (good), tailed off when last seen in October; has to remain of interest off this mark with trip/ground to suit.

quotes.quote: Arrycan came out of the Kilbeggan race well and is probably one for the bigger, more galloping tracks. He got into a lovely rhythm and he jumped for fun. We'll probably aim for the Galway Blazers - Liam Cusack, trainer.
Good ground is the key to Arrycan and Eoin got him into a lovely rhythm. He stays well. We could go for the opportunity handicap chase at Leopardstown over Christmas  - Liam Cusack, trainer.

Arrycan had a promising debut (over fences) in Limerick and he has improved a lot from that run. He had a little look around after the back of the last but he rattled away up the hill then - Eoin Walsh, jockey.

runners.name: Ilbdare
runners.comment: Recent Tramore third was encouraging; good chance he'll stay and tongue-tie now tried
runners.spotlight: Local challenger was placed here over 2m4f last summer (good) and looked to be on the way back when third at Tramore last month (winner won again last week); unproven over this far but good chance he'll stay and tongue-tie now tried.

runners.name: Love Bite
runners.comment: Points' winner; interesting jockey booking on yard debut in first handicap
runners.spotlight: Didn't show much under rules in Britain but got off the mark with a point-to-point win in November; interesting jockey booking on yard debut in first handicap (1lb wrong).

stable_tour.quote: Wonderfully bred being a half-sister to Might Bite and a sister to Beat That, she couldn't win a bumper, but neither could they, and the penny was dropping on her second outing over hurdles. She's done very well over the summer and three miles could help her uphold family honour. 30-10-23

runners.name: Oskar High
runners.comment: Veteran a C&D winner; runs well fresh and ground to suit so don't discount
runners.spotlight: Veteran's seven career wins include one over C&D and more recently in 2m6f Galway handicap last September off lowly 80; soft ground not ideal when pulled up at same venue in October; runs well fresh and ground to suit here so don't discount (2lb wrong).

quotes.quote: Oskar High got a good ride from Shane. He let him roll along and roll along. I was afraid the ground was drying out for him but he is a great little horse and a credit to everyone - Norman Lee, trainer

Oskar High is a special little horse. This is the first time in a while where he had his ground, any time I tried to run him this summer the ground has been too quick. He'll go for something similar again - Norman Lee, trainer.
Oskar High is a great little fun horse and he really toughed it out over the trip. Darragh gave him a great ride, and he'll go for something similar - Norman Lee, trainer
My horses weren't right until recently and that win was a needed one. Oskar High wants nice ground and could run at Ballinrobe on Tuesday - Norman Lee, trainer

runners.name: Eddies Pride
runners.comment: Better chaser; first run over hurdles since December 2023 and 8lb out of the handicap
runners.spotlight: Two chase wins came on much softer ground; 0-21 hurdling, first run over hurdles since December 2023 and 8lb out of the handicap.

quotes.quote: Eddies Pride needs to be ridden cold and to come late, Gary gave her a fantastic ride and did exactly as he was told. She's a lovely, well-bred mare that has had a lot of niggly problems. She'll stay at it - Norman Lee, trainer.

8:30.race_name: Summer Is Coming Sligo Flat Race

runners.name: Cosmos Dainay
runners.breeder: E A R L Elevage D Ainay
runners.comment: Point winner, carried out on Rules' debut, didn't stay 2m4f latest, claims down in trip
runners.spotlight: Point-to-point winner was carried out on Rules' debut at Clonmel in March; weakened late over 2m4f at the same track last month when sent off at 11-4; this shorter trip should suit better; leading claims.

runners.name: Hillfort Manor
runners.comment: Tagula gelding, dam won on the Flat in Italy, stamina a query on breeding, check market
runners.spotlight: Tagula gelding was unsold for 4,800Euros as a yearling; fourth foal; dam Italian 1m-1m2f winner, half-sister to Group-placed 6f 2yo winner Jeanne Girl, family of 1m Group 1 winner Rajeem; stamina a query on breeding but worth a market check on debut.

runners.name: Miracle Knights
runners.comment: Decorated Knight gelding, half-brother to bumper winner, could go well on debut
runners.spotlight: Decorated Knight half-brother to winners Tritone Red (Italian 1m1f), Langafel (2m1f hurdle) and Lispendense (bumper); dam 1m4f AW winner (RPR 68), from family of top miler Hawk Wing; yard 2-10 in bumpers at this venue; could go well on debut.

runners.name: Paymelater
runners.comment: Showed more on latest at Tramore, this longer trip will suit, place claims if fit
runners.spotlight: Long odds for all three starts in bumpers; well-beaten in the first two but signs of promise when a keeping on 7.75l third of 15 at odds of 80-1 at Tramore (16.5f, gd-yld) when last seen in August; this trip should suit on that evidence; place chance if fit after break.

runners.name: Shudawudacuddagh
runners.comment: Respectable debut over 2m4f, shaped like this shorter trip might suit, needs more to win
runners.spotlight: Respectable effort when midfield on debut in a 2m4f bumper on good to yielding at Clonmel; weakened late on so this shorter trip might suit but needs more to win.

runners.name: Tuffliketiger
runners.comment: 100-1 when beaten on debut at Limerick in March 2022, off the track since, best watched
runners.spotlight: 100-1 when beaten 21l on debut in a listed bumper at Limerick in March 2022; off the track since so is entitled to need this run after such a long layoff; best watched.

runners.name: Champagne Melanie
runners.comment: 150-1 and tailed off on debut at Limerick, cheekpieces discarded, may need more time
runners.spotlight: Sent off at 150-1 on debut in a Limerick bumper last month and tailed off; cheekpieces worn that day are left off; may need more time.
